dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole dysfunctional megalopolis, beige and blurry in summer smog. If this is the American Dream, do me a favor wake me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The traffic loop outside the terminals is gridlocked -- m with stretch limousines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, the airport is done up with festive posters, stre and banners: Welcome - Pacific Partners Summit A planeload of cheerful CHINESE DELEGATES come into the crowded terminal. Some sport red T-shirts with a picture Mao wearing Mickey Mouse ears. They get onto the people mover, passing by a TV REPORTER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to TV CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eager to mend its tarnished image, Los Angeles has really put out the welcome mat for tomorrow's summit. The city promises quite a party as leaders from Japan, China, South Korea, Australia, the U.S. and others begin talks for the largest free-trade treaty in history. The SCENE changes to TAPE of DELEGATES from other countri arriving. Then, we see massive SECURITY PREPARATIONS all around the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one sour note is North Korea, the only Pacific Rim country not participating. There are rumors of secret meetings with North Korean representatives, but U.S. officials insist the North must first hold democratic elections, and halt its nuclear weapons program -- as they claimed to have done back in 1995. We CUT TO a heated debate in the UN SECURITY COUNCIL. Then ARTILLERY FIRE over the Korean DMZ. The SCENE returns to LAX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tensions remain high since last year's skirmishes between North Korea and the U.S. So any chance of the communist North joining the Pacific Partners seems highly unlikely.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FREMONT PLACE
dialogues.text: An exclusive, walled-off section of Hancock Park. There's one route in and out, past a manned guardhouse on Wilshir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Colonial-style mansion, surrounded by an imposing, wrou iron fence. There is a bronze plaque, in English and Kore next to the entranceway:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consulate of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Democratic People's Republic of Korea The driveway gate opens and a long, black Mercedes with t windows and diplomatic license plates glides out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An alert North Korean CORPORAL watches the perimeter MONI He pushes a switch to close the gate behind the Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From atop a pole outside the south wall, a man with binoc overlooks the private streets of Fremont Place.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: as the Mercedes cruises through the quiet neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The man, PAUL JAVAL, is thirtyish, nervous; with short, s hair. He takes the binoculars away from his face and we s his eyes -- they're a strange, unnaturally light gray. Javal takes an ORANGE PILL from an unlabeled prescription bottle and pops it into his mouth. He climbs down the pol a van with a phone company logo on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mercedes comes out of the Fremont Place gate, and tur into the heavy morning traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is extremely quiet, due to inch-thick glass on the win and 4,000 pounds of armor plating on the car's chassis. The DRIVER is a North Korean Army Major. On the seat besi him is an AMD-74, a 5.45x39mm-caliber machine gun. A HAND from the back seat darts between the front seats a turns on the RADIO to a ROCK station. The Driver turns it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hand belongs to 10-year-old SAM KE HAN. Sam sits back sighs to his sister, JOY (15). Between them sits a middle Scandinavian GOVERNESS. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stand it -- half an hour to get to the stupid school every morning... with no music... (Korean; subtitled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Just our damn Nanny...]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal's van, also with tinted windows, turns onto Crensha follows the Mercedes, several cars behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal, wired, drums on the steering wheel while driving. glances at some expertly constructed, radio-control REMOT UNITS sitting on the seat next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traffic is moving at about 35 MPH. The Mercedes merges on the freeway, heading west. Javal's van follows. The thumping of a RAP SONG rattles the other drivers' fil as a LOWRIDER with its stereo turned up to "11" cruises b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even 500 watts of bass cannot penetrate the armored silen The Driver scans the road, wary but sensing no danger. He on his blinker to take the 405 South exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van follows, now directly behind the Mercedes, in a procession of vehicles going up the long, curved overpass arcing 100 feet above the 10, toward the 405.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they approach the crest of the overpass, Javal flips a switch on his radio-control unit...

dialogues.speaker: ROAD SURFACE OF OVERPASS
dialogues.text: Six small SEMICIRCLES, exact replicas of the stay-alert b on the white lines of the overpass, EXPLODE. They spew hu of sharp, triangular nails across the roadway. Immediatel scores of tires on passing cars BLOW OUT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Causing, 50 yards ahead of the Mercedes and van, the most hellacious, gut-wrenching, piss-your-pants, chain-reactio PILE-UP you can imagine. Dozens of drivers LOSE CONTROL of their vehicles... sides their neighbors... grind against the guard rails. Some fishtail into 180's, smashing headlong into the traffic s coming onto the overpass. Brakes squeal, people scream, metal crumples, airbags dep glass shatters. And then it gets really nasty... A Honda gets jammed under a truck hauling cinder blocks. truck JACKKNIFES, tipping over like a drunken giant. It SMASHES through the concrete wall and guard rail... Along with several cars and their SCREAMING OCCUPANTS, sw over the edge by the truck like discarded soda cans. They plummet through space, CRASHING onto the freeway bel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Joy, and the Governess brace themselves as the Drive slams on the brakes. He barely avoids hitting anything. DRIVER (Korean)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Stay in the car.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nightmare scene of smoke, twisted wrecks, dazed victims Mercedes and van sit motionless in the backed-up traffic. INT./EXT.  JAVAL'S VAN & ROADWAY - DAY Javal slides open a TRAP DOOR on the floor of the van. He slips a wheeled, mechanic's repair platform through it.

dialogues.speaker: JAVAL
dialogues.text: as, unnoticed amid the chaos, he lies on the platform and rolls under the Mercedes. The undercarriage of the Mercedes is armored with steel. stops at a patch of perforations -- an air exchange vent. attaches a slim DEVICE over the vent, flips a switch on i then rolls back toward the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oblivious to Javal's actions below them, everyone watches police and news helicopters circle above. Then, some CHP motorcycles straddle the lanes and zoom by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweating, Javal sits back in the driver's seat and checks another radio unit. Working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHP has cleared a path through the devastation, and traffic trickles through. As the Mercedes and the van pas Javal looks proudly at the misery he's wrought. He follow Mercedes onto the 405 south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal drives behind the Mercedes, with one hand on the ra unit. The Mercedes signals to take the Venice exit. Javal fingers the radio unit, itching to use it... But he PASSES by the Mercedes as it gets off the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal's device is armed, and waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pretty street in the Miracle Mile, lined with neat, sin family homes. Timed SPRINKLER systems water some of the y Every house on the block except the one we're in front of a "For Sale" sign on the lawn. From the weathered looks o signs, they've been there for quite a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hot night. The ceiling fan above the bed spins slo PETE CARSON tosses restlessly in bed, the sheets half-cov him. Next to him his wife, MIRANDA KNOLL, snores contente Carson is in his late thirties, outdoorsy, with a tight, muscular build. Emotionally he's tightly-wound as well. Miranda is 35, raven-haired, sensible, pretty. She believ above all else that one should never raise one's voice. Carson groans... he's DREAMING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick, SILENT IMAGES: A street cordoned off with police t Cops, SWAT teams, FBI surround BEVERLY THRIFT, a bank. Carson, younger, hair shorter, sits in an FBI COMMAND TRU across from the bank. Covering the mouthpiece of the phon his hand, he's arguing with the OTHER AGENTS in the truck Suddenly, a huge, fiery EXPLOSION blows out the front of bank building. Horrified, Carson runs toward it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson is snapped awake by a CAR ALARM going off outside. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch! He bolts out of bed, wearing nothing but a pair of stripe bikini briefs. Miranda rolls over, sleepy, unconcerned... MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete... please... we have to be up early tomorrow. Call the police. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. He races down the hall -- right past the house alarm keyp its LCD reading "ARMED." He grabs an aluminum baseball bat from the umbrella stand Forgetting to disarm the house alarm, he yanks the front open. The house alarm begins SHRIEKING. CARSON (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: pulls the pillows over her head and sighs. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson comes around to the driveway, which is illuminated the streetlight -- Where two 20-ish ASSHOLES are sitting in his 1965 Mustang convertible, their presence courtesy of a huge cut they'v made in the otherwise-perfect ragtop. Car-theft tools in a leather case between them, they're p the ignition switch out of the dashboard. Asshole #1 spots Carson. He gets out of the car, wielding crowbar. His partner keeps working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole #1 lunges viciously, swiping at Carson with the crowbar, taking a piece out of his side. Carson starts BLEEDING profusely, but he's too pissed to notice. Carson uses his bat to take the offensive. They go at eac other like combatants in a swordfight, the CLANKING of me echoing through the neighborhood along with the screaming house and car ALARMS, and frantic neighborhood DOGS. Surprised at Carson's fury and strength, Asshole #1 backs the lawn, oblivious to the running SPRINKLERS. As he backs away, his shoe catches on one of the sprinkle heads. It breaks off, and a huge GEYSER of water sprays o Carson holds his bat in both hands and jams the front of into Asshole #1's breadbasket. He doubles over. Carson grabs Asshole #1's arm, and pulls it quickly again his raised knee. There is a SNAP and a loud howl as the a breaks, and Carson tosses him aside. Seeing this, Asshole #2 gives up on the car. He takes off toward the street. Carson runs to head him off, but he's faster in his Air Jordans than Carson is in his bare feet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson grabs the metal lid from a garbage can at the curb FLINGS it like a huge Frisbee. It sails across the street And NAILS Asshole #2's head. He kisses the pavement, stun Carson runs up and grabs him, but he pulls out a long, sh screwdriver and jabs at Carson with it. Then, blue flashing lights appear from around the corner: WESTEC Chevy Blazer. Two uniformed GUARDS get out, and fu with their sidearms. WESTEC GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody... chill! Bikini boy! On the ground! Asshole #2 is still trying to gouge Carson with the screwdriver. Carson glares at the dopey Guards. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole was trying to boost my car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson's fiftyish, black, next-door NEIGHBOR, wearing paj and a robe, comes out of his house. Carson sees him. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike -- call 911! NEIGHBOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been trying... (has a cordless phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's busy. (to Guards; re Carson)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the good guy, you schumcks. The Guards seem to get it. Without warning, one takes out TASER and ZAPS Asshole #2. Carson lets go just in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding his bleeding side, Carson walks back to his house notices the "Neighborhood Watch" sign has graffiti spray- painted on it. He touches it -- the paint is still wet. H Neighbor shrugs -- whatta ya gonna do? The PAPER GUY drives by... and tosses Carson's newspaper under the gushing SPRINKLER. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this fuckin' town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy is standing on the toilet, blowing cigarette smoke in the exhaust fan. Someone KNOCKS on the door. She flicks t cigarette into the toilet, puts a ZIPPO LIGHTER in her po

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy opens the bathroom door. Sam is standing there, grinn JOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are six bathrooms in this house, Sam. SAM (fanning the air)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But only one with a smoking section. She quickly closes the door behind her. Sam laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Joy sit at the table. AMBASSADOR HAN and MRS. HAN having breakfast: radish soup, kimchi and grilled fish. Ambassador Han reads through the morning's faxed communiq He's 43, rarely smiles, and hates living in the U.S. He's dressed in an impeccably-tailored, Valentino two-piece su Mrs. Han is slender, soft-spoken, but as iron-willed as h husband. She, however, is quick to smile. She's wearing a summery dress with a white sweater over her shoulders. Ambassador Han pulls the front of Sam's shirt to reveal t "Nirvana" logo on his T-shirt. AMBASSADOR HAN (Korean)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Go change.] Ambassador Han's X-ray stare turns to Joy. AMBASSADOR HAN (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You smell like a fireplace.] A BUTLER appears with a phone. He WHISPERS to Mrs. Han. MRS. HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Governess... (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Hilda...

dialogues.speaker: CUTAWAY
dialogues.text: as she speaks into a cellular phone. She's extremely nerv We cannot see her surroundings. GOVERNESS (thru phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Han... I am very sick today...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. HAN (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will see you next week... (hangs up; smiles to kids)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears I'll be taking you to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back of his van, Javal pats the Governess' hand. JAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. You may go now... He speaks with a slight accent, French, perhaps. He pops orange pill, then unlatches the rear doors of the van. Wi quick glance back at him, she goes to open the doors. Javal grabs a plastic tarp and throws it over the Governe upper body. He puts his arm across her neck, flicks open gravity knife and PLUNGES it through the tarp, into her c He drops her on the floor of the van and fastidiously wip small smudge of blood from his hand with a handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson steps out of the shower. He looks exhausted. Towel off, he goes into the bedroom, where Miranda is riding an exercise bike, listening to music on headphones and readi the sprinkler-soaked newspaper, all while watching the TV

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: A perky blonde traffic reporter, BOBBI MARCHFELDER, talks us from a local NEWS COPTER. BOBBI (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Good morning, Summit Day! It's gonna be the Super Bowl, the 4th of July, the Olympics and Woodstock all rolled into one! All over town there'll be parades, concerts, rallies, festivals... So get out there everyone, but plan your drive- time accordingly! This is Bobbi Marchfelder, your Eye in the Sky... We CUT TO the White House lawn, where the PRESIDENT is ab to board a helicopter. MORNING ANCHOR (VO) (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President is on his way... PRESIDENT (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It's an honor hosting my fellow leaders in Los Angeles, the capitol city of the Pacific Rim... We CUT BACK to the studio and the MORNING ANCHOR. MORNING ANCHOR (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see the menu for Mayor Simpson's Brentwood barbecue, right after this... We CUT TO a MUSICAL MONTAGE of preparations for the event around town.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As the MUSIC swells, Carson turns the TV off. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was watching that. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I hear one more Beach Boys song, I'll shoot myself. Miranda points at the headphones -- she can't hear him. CARSON (continuing; while smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, if we were having sex once in a while, you wouldn't need to ride that fucking bike every morning. MIRANDA (hasn't heard a thing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right with you... As Carson dresses, we get a LOOK at their bedroom -- Mira nightstand has two neat stacks of periodicals on it, with Angeles magazine and Psychology Today on the top of them. Carson's nightstand is overflowing with books and magazin about other cities and states: Wonderland Washington; Magnificent Oregon; Welcome to North Carolina." INT./EXT.  CARSON'S HOUSE - PATIO & KITCHEN - DAY Miranda, dressed in a conservative skirt, jacket, black s is out on the patio. Her breakfast -- a bowl of fruit and wheat germ -- sits on the patio table while she waters so sickly-looking ROSE BUSHES in a planter. Carson, dressed in shirt and tie, looking beat, fries a s and three eggs in butter. He comes outside with his break and a magazine article: "American Expatriates in New Zeal MIRANDA (looks him over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you gotten any sleep lately? CARSON (ignores the question)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shop's gonna tow the car in -- goddamn ignition's trashed. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take mine. I'll ride in with Diane. Carson watches as she carefully picks the dead leaves off rose bushes. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ask me, those suckers are a lost cause. She continues, then glances at the article Carson is read MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not for you. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean it's not for you. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't chase car thieves in my underwear. C'mon, you'd die of boredom if we ever sold this house and moved. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd die of shock, from finding anyone dumb enough to buy the place. Even for what it's worth now. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of people bought at the top of the market... CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sure cheers me right up. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why we even talk about it. The city's not the problem. So we move. It wouldn't matter. What's that saying: "Wherever you go, there you are." Carson just looks at her. Reaching for the salt, he wince from the cut in his side. MIRANDA (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're current on your tetanus booster. Was it worth it? CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One cut... two assholes in the hospital... Yep. Carson glances at his watch and gets up. CARSON (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, another day of baby-sitting my favorite bunch of people... He grabs a Bianchi shoulder holster with a Sig-Sauer P-22 9mm pistol, straps it on, then pulls on a blue windbreake Emblazoned on the back are large yellow letters: FBI. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask for a transfer. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not gonna transfer me. You know damn well why I was bumped down to guard duty... (as he's leaving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My outstanding people skills. Miranda tries to return to tending her roses. But instead sadly watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of sorrow crosses Carson's face as he watches some YOUNG KIDS laugh and shove, getting onto a school bus. He then glances at his wounded Mustang, parked in the str He spots something on the windshield: A pink parking tick The parking sign above the graffiti-stained Neighborhood sign reads: Street Cleaning - Friday 8-10 AM. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this fuckin' town. Carson CHIRPS open Miranda's car: a red Volvo 960. As he pulls away, we SEE a bumper sticker on the car: a c and slash through cartoon weapons on one side, cartoon te bears on the other, and "Arms Are For Hugging" in between

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver backs the Mercedes out of the garage behind th Consulate. We notice there is ANOTHER MERCEDES parked ins Mrs. Han, Sam and Joy come outside. They hear some heartf

dialogues.speaker: SWEARING
dialogues.text: ANGRY VOICE (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn Limey overpriced piece a shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the driveway across the street, a man in a business su has his head under the hood of a brand-new Jaguar convert The JAG OWNER's 15-year-old, blonde daughter, LISA, sits the car with her schoolbooks in her lap.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: turns to Mrs. Han: JOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we give Lisa a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It pulls into the driveway across the street. The Jag Own still SWEARING mightily. Lisa climbs into the Mercedes. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Joy... Sam... Joy rolls the window up and the SOUND of cursing disappea LISA (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent -- I can't hear him! SAM (raps on window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glass is an inch thick. (points to doors, roof)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armor-plated. Bulletproof. Bomb- proof. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect car for L.A. (looks back at her Dad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starts, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Mercedes travels its usual route down Crenshaw, Ja van begins following it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where Javal's DEVICE is attached, still waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark-green government Dodge pulls up and parks behind o just like it on a paved area near the Consulate gate. DAVE JUAREZ, (chubby, 40, Mexican-American, a desk jockey out of the Dodge and hangs an FBI shield over his top poc He glances over at North Korean Security Chief COLONEL LE (45), who has paused inside the gate to regard Dave, and outside world, with profound contempt. Dave, attachГ€ case in one hand and notebook computer in other, walks to a 10-by-15 detached guardhouse on the far corner of the property, just outside the high fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside are two desks and four chairs, a console of communication equipment, a microwave and a Mr. Coffee. Dave enters. Two FBI agents, finishing their shift, gathe their belongings: ROBBINS (late 20's; male; thinning hair SABATINI, (early 30's; cute; dark, bobbed hair; female). They wear blue FBI blazers and have standard-FBI-issue 10 Heckler & Koch MP-5 machine pistols in oversized shou rigs. Dave is in civilian clothes, and is not armed. ROBBINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Dave the Computer Man! Actually escaped the office! DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doin' field upgrades. Gives 'em a chance to hose out my cage. He glances through the window at Colonel Lee. DAVE (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the fuckin' gargoyle? ROBBINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their Chief of Security, Colonel Lee. Sabatini makes the jerk-off sign with her hand. SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Chuckles," as we're inclined to call him. (yawns; flops in a chair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friggin' graveyard shift... ROBBINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love to know what dope made it the Bureau's job to give full-time protection to foreign consulates. (offers coffee to Dave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cup a mud? DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you made it. Why don't you get Sabatini to brew the java? She's the alleged chick. SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow me. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Carson? SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his way. Some creeps tried to rip off his Mustang last night. (beat; solemnly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cut the ragtop. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfuckers... Dave takes three PCMCIA computer cards from his attachГ€ DAVE (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Latest and greatest. Wireless network link-ups. SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, slow down, I'm gonna pee. ROBBINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van drives in the lane alongside the Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUMMING, Javal drives with one hand, while tapping with h other on the top of the radio-controlled remote box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they approach the light at Washington Blvd, just turni yellow, Javal's van gets in front of the Mercedes. Their lanes stop for the red light. A FRUIT VENDOR holdin bag of oranges walks from car to car. Javal slips the van into neutral and lets it roll back un his rear bumper taps gently against the Mercedes' front b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver hits the HORN. The van doesn't move. The Drive glances in the rear-view: There's a Jeep Cherokee tight on his tail, and the BLACK in it is busy dealing with a carpool full of 8-year-old K The Driver looks at Mrs. Han, who's peering out the side window, fascinated by the African-American-themed storefr They're all festooned with Summit-related banners, and SH OWNERS are preparing for a community sidewalk bazaar. Sam, bored, stuffs several pieces of GUM into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal flips the switch on his radio-controlled remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the Mercedes, the device Javal planted there begins emit thick, white CS TEAR GAS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GAS pours in through the ventilation system. Everyone inside starts coughing and choking uncontrollably. The Dr grabs his AMD-74 machine gun and pops the door locks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver, Mrs. Han, Joy, Sam and Lisa pile out of the c Jittering with excitement, fear and speed, Javal hops out his van, holding a Benelli M-1, a semi-automatic shotgun. He SHOOTS the Driver in the chest. The BLAST from the sho muzzle, however, is unlike anything we've ever seen befor is blindingly BRIGHT, even in broad daylight, belching a cluster of glowing, white-hot magnesium. The Driver flies back against the Mercedes, EMPTYING his machine gun into the air. The wound in his chest is full BURNING magnesium shrapnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other drivers in the intersection see this and go completely nuts. Some duck for cover under their dashboar Others peel away. A few COLLIDE with oncoming traffic. The Carpool Lady in the Cherokee pushes the kids down on floor. The Fruit Vendor hides by rolling under a car. Sam and Joy are incapacitated by tear-gas coughing fits. Han stumbles toward them, trying to get them to run away. Javal PUNCHES her, knocking her down. He turns to Lisa, surprised to see her. Sweating, he poin the shotgun at her... almost pulls the trigger... then no Mrs. Han's expression of horror and thinks the better of He spots a MOTORIST in a Ford Escort, peering cautiously his dashboard to get a look at the action. Javal SHOOTS the Motorist through the windshield with ano bright, searing blast of magnesium. The Motorist and the entire front of his car burst into FLAMES. Mrs. Han is on her knees, sobbing. Javal grabs her by the and pulls her to the back of the van. He opens the doors. JAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that I'm serious in my intention, yes? (she nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you cooperate, you and your children will be home for dinner tonight. He tightens his grip on her. She nods again, then looks a kids. Javal shoves her, Sam, Joy and Lisa into the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs three pairs of handcuffs off a C-shaped bar weld both ends to the inside of the van. He handcuffs one of M Han's arms, passes the chain through the bar, then handcu the other. He does the same with Sam; then handcuffs one Joy's arms, passes the chain through and attaches the oth handcuff to Lisa. Javal hops in his seat and drives away on Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several people, including the Carpool Lady, rush over to Driver, who lies DEAD and SMOLDERING on the ground. His hand is halfway inside his bloody pants pocket, holdi small plastic card with the Consulate's phone number on i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Lee and a North Korean Army OFFICER come running ANOTHER OFFICER starts up a car in the back of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbins and Sabatini see the commotion and go to investig Dave follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambassador Han runs out. He has a stricken look on his fa COLONEL LEE (Korean; to Ambassador Han)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You must stay here.] Ambassador Han nods. The FBI agents run up. To them: AMBASSADOR HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone took my family! The agents look at each other -- holy shit! Colonel Lee's SCREECHES to a stop. Sabatini stands in front of it. SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got no jurisdiction outside this property! Colonel Lee shoves a big, ugly Tokorev 7.62x25mm-caliber pistol in her face as he's opening the car door. SABATINI (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! (to Ambassador Han)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yank his fuckin' leash! AMBASSADOR HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My men are going! Colonel Lee jumps into the car and it screeches away, alm running Sabatini over. AMBASSADOR HAN (continuing; to Sabatini)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a white telephone van, driving west on Washington Boulevard. The agents rush back to their guardhouse. Dave's governme Dodge is blocking theirs. ROBBINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keys! Dave tosses them to Robbins. Sabatini shoves Dave into th back seat. He looks at her, dumbfounded. SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're ridin' shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave is thrown against the back of the seat by the ACCELE ROBBINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cherry? DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the seat. Sabatini grabs the red flashing light, puts it on the das ROBBINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siren? DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! I'm never in a fuckin' hurry..!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FREMONT PLACE
dialogues.text: Just as they race out of Fremont Place past the guard gat Carson, in Miranda's Volvo, comes in on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson sees the agents in the Dodge and floors the Volvo. fishtails, making a U-turn. He straddles the lanes on Wilshire to pull up next to the All the cars in front of them swerve to clear out of the He rolls down his window. Sabatini shouts over to him: SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone snatched Han's family! White phone van, westbound on Washington! Carson looks like he's been punched in the stomach. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a secure radio! Sabatini takes a small two-way MOTOROLA RADIO out of her pocket and throws it through her window to Carson. Droppi in his lap, he punches the gas. Robbins floors Dave's pie shit Dodge, trying to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diplomatic Liaison EARL WALTHER is using the reflection i office window to adjust his necktie. Walther is 30, good- looking, black; a GS lifer working his way up the ranks b virtue of his quiet competence. A CO-WORKER sticks his head into the office, then shields eyes from the sight of Walther's sharp new suit. CO-WORKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's been to Nordstroms, big time. WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clothes make the man. CO-WORKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But does the man make enough for the clothes? WALTHER (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man makes payments on his Visa. Walther's SECRETARY rushes in. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Walther... priority line! WALTHER (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Diplomatic Liaison Earl Walther... What's the nature of your emer -- (grimaces)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Jesus... not today... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll inform channels and get a copter in the air. For God's sake, keep it quiet. Do what you can, but don't endanger civilians or the family!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson drives with one hand, while holding the radio. CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet -- nice and easy. Real easy, until he narrowly MISSES a bunch of cars when SCREECHING around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walther presses the intercom button on the phone. WALTHER (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the Secretary of State on the horn. (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he left already. I'm familiar with the concept of time zones. Find his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson turns the frequency on his two-way. CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbins, Sabatini... Chopper's on its way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving skillfully, Carson edges past the North Koreans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, Carson can't believe it: he spots Javal's van, couple blocks ahead, driving at normal speed. CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out! Ahead, on the right! SABATINI (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think it's them? CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... but it seems too easy... I'll move up; he won't suspect a civilian car. Stay back, then get on his ass when I signal. We'll box him in. He looks over at Colonel Lee, whose car is pacing his. CARSON (continuing; into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the Mod Squad gets in your way, don't be shy about getting 'em out. SABATINI (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glaring, Colonel Lee looks over at the FBI cars as they p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sabatini pulls out her machine pistol, and tosses the two to Dave. He looks scared, and carsick. SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't puke... I hate when guys puke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson tries to approach Javal without drawing his attent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He still drives at the same speed as the surrounding traf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carson nonchalantly passes, Javal NOTICES the governme issue two-way radio sitting on the seat of Carson's Volvo

dialogues.speaker: JAVAL
dialogues.text: grins... it's show-time. He STOMPS on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pissed that he's been made, Carson speeds up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving fast, Javal makes a hard right. As the van leans the turn, something rolls out from under a sheet of canva the floor -- the Governess' BODY, bloodied and grotesque the plastic tarp it's wrapped in. Joy starts SCREAMING, as does everyone else when they see Javal pulls out a Beretta Centurion 9mm pistol and FIRES deafening round through the roof of the van. JAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to concentrate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During a lull in traffic, a WELL-DRESSED WOMAN jaywalks a the street. An LAPD black-and-white changes lanes and put its flashing lights. As two COPS write her a ticket... Around the corner TWO MEN make a quick exchange of money vial of crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cops do notice Javal speeding by, with Carson's Volvo FBI Dodge and Colonel Lee's car in hot pursuit. They shov ticket in the Well-Dressed Woman's hand and hop in their

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal turns onto the side streets -- rows of run-down apartment buildings. He takes a circuitous route, gaining one-block lead on Carson and the others. Then, he makes a sudden turn into a one-way alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal hits a remote garage door opener. Ahead, rickety do on one of a line of detached garages facing the alley OPE Across from the garage, parked parallel against the back empty building, we notice a duplicate van. It's facing th same direction as Javal is driving. Javal slams on the brakes, stopping just past the garage, then quickly backs up into the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he pulls in, we catch GLIMPSES of the van slipping bac into a FIBERGLASS SUPERSTRUCTURE that fits tightly around rear two-thirds of it. As the van comes to a stop, severa buckles on the edge of the superstructure spring closed. Javal reaches out the van window and pulls on a rope hang from the ceiling of the garage. The rope releases the doo from the opening mechanism, so it immediately falls CLOSE Then, Javal turns several switches on another of his neat constructed remotes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steel straps are holding the steering wheel rigid. A set of relays, triggered remotely, start the engine; Engage the transmission; And supply fuel to the carburetor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The duplicate van takes off down the alley. Just as it ge to speed, Carson and the others round the corner into the behind it. As far as they know, they're still chasing Jav The alley is several blocks long, running parallel to the road, separated at each block by perpendicular streets. T duplicate van races along, scraping against parked cars a the rear walls of buildings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna wrap it around something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed, as the duplicate van crosses a street, cars swerv avoid hitting it. It continues into the next alley. Up ahead, a garbage truck lumbers into the far end of the alley, its metal lift-rods extended to pick up a dumpster CARSON (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit... The duplicate van CRASHES into the garbage truck and EXPL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson, horrified, jumps out of his car. Robbins and Saba run up. They have to hold Carson away from the burning va Dave hurries to the back of a building and gets sick. Colonel Lee, wide-eyed with anger, gets in Carson's face. COLONEL LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should not have interfered! Carson shoves Colonel Lee out of his way, hard. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in no mood... Colonel Lee comes back, ready for a fight. Carson is happ oblige, but Robbins grabs Carson's arm. ROBBINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about him! By now, ONLOOKERS have begun to gather, as LAPD black-and whites and helicopters converge on the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A block away, the garage door opens, and we hear somethin eerie and unexpected: a scratchy, music-box kids' SONG, c from a loudspeaker. Javal's van pulls out and we see its TRANSFORMATION: The superstructure surrounding the body of the van makes it l like a graffiti-covered, unlicensed ice cream vendor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entrance of the alley is blocked by a black-and-white accompanied by the SONG, Javal drives along the one-way a in his camouflaged van, passing unnoticed by the authorit Anguished, Carson is staring at the BURNING duplicate van

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly Thrift EXPLODES and BURNS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson tries to shake the memory away. He looks around, s that something isn't right, then turns to the other agent CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get back to the Consulate. Off their perplexed looks, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One room, bathroom and kitchenette. A laptop computer and peripherals are on a table, along with some cell phones, toolbox, and some jumbles of electronic circuitry. In the main room, there are three large Lazy-Boy easy cha side by side, facing a 27-inch TV on a stand. A cloth cov two OBJECTS sitting atop the TV. The door opens. Mrs. Han, Joy, Sam, and Lisa walk in, rig with fear. Javal, Beretta 9mm in hand, comes in behind th and closes the door. Javal strips off his sweat-soaked sh and wipes his face with it. Mrs. Han realizes he's wired the moon... and it terrifies her. JAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone need to use the rest room? This will be your last opportunity for a few hours. (no takers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. Mrs. Han, Sam, Joy, please sit here. (indicates the Lazy Boys; then turns to Lisa)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you... what is your name? LISA (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa... Still holding the Beretta, he grabs a polo shirt from the closet and pulls it on. As the family sits in the chairs: JAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mrs. Han, this one. Thank you. He takes a pair of handcuffs out of his pants pocket. He to handcuff Lisa, hands behind her back, but she resists. JAVAL (continuing; sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You afford me some additional bargaining power. But not much. She wilts. Javal cuffs her to the handles of the refriger He puts a strip of duct tape from his tool box across her He uncovers one of the items atop the TV: An electronic b three pairs of oversized, LED VU meters on the front of i We NOTICE neat lines of wires running from each of the ch up into it. Javal flips one of a row of switches on it; a green light and the meters come to life. JAVAL (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. No taping your mouths, no restraints. Please remain still while I explain. The meters on the left indicate sound pressure -- Decibels. There are microphones on your chair backs. If you raise your voices above certain level, putting your meter in the red zone for more than one sustained second, the circuit will be closed. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The right meters indicate motion. There are pressure sensors inside the armrests and seats. The sensors don't like to get wet, so I hope you were honest about not needing to use the loo. If you make any excess movements, or try to leave your chair, the circuit will be closed. MRS. HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand... She looks at her sound meter, which jumped close to the r MRS. HAN (continuing; softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens if the circuit closes? JAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaboom... He uncovers the other item atop the TV -- a one-pound bri C-4 high explosive with the detonation mechanism jammed i it. Mrs. Han gasps and begins to PANIC. JAVAL (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy... deep breath... (to the kids)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do each of you understand? They nod. Tears roll down Joy's face. JAVAL (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your wits, and all will be fine. He flips another switch and the green light turns yellow. then turns on the TV. COVERAGE of the Summit is everywher COMMENTATOR #1 (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Not since the '84 Olympics has the whole city had an such an opportunity -- Javal turns the channel to a SOAP, and MUTES it. He start pacing, and glances at his watch. It's 9:15 AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl Walther looks through the window as his copter lands the lawn behind the North Korean Consulate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the copter lands, Carson comes out to meet Walther. WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson? (Carson nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walther. Who told the Ambassador? CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His Security Chief. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a civilian with them -- fifteen-year-old girl from across the street. We're trying to reach the parents. WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it... (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mrs. Han was the North Korean Premier's niece! We're hearing rumors they're gonna make a major issue out of what happened here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson and Walther come into the house. We hear only the TICKING of the grandfather clock in the foyer. Colonel Lee and his Officers stand by the stairs; Robbins Sabatini and Dave stand together near the front door. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure what happened here. Something smells. Asshole was acting like he wanted us to spot him... WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about? AMBASSADOR HAN (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Walther? Ambassador Han comes down the stairs, his face tight with repressed emotion. WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambassador Han... my deepest -- AMBASSADOR HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I have no wish for condolences. Just answers. WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as we have any to give... Suddenly, the Butler sprints across the foyer. He shoves cordless phone into Ambassador Han's hands. Ambassador Han listens to the phone, then takes in a shar breath and sits on the steps. AMBASSADOR HAN (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoon..?! CARSON (to FBI agents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start a trace! Carson is elated. Robbins, Sabatini and Dave rush out. Wa pulls out a cell phone and hits a speed-dial key. WALTHER (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Secretary... they're alive! COLONEL LEE (to Carson; incensed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are tapping our phones?! CARSON (while crossing to Ambassador Han)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you didn't know. And I'm Meryl Streep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal is holding his cell phone next to Mrs. Han's face. MRS. HAN (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are not hurt. But this man is very serious -- He pulls the phone from her, takes a breath to compose hi JAVAL (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to remember the feeling you had when you thought your family was dead, and use it to inform the choices you're about to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say you want to talk to the kids... AMBASSADOR HAN (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know my children are all right. JAVAL (VO) (thru phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be in front of a television in two minutes. Tune it to channel four. You'll get the picture. Javal hangs up. Stunned, Ambassador Han stands up. AMBASSADOR HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a television in my office. As Carson, Ambassador Han, Colonel Lee and Walther hurry the office in the back of the house, Carson's radio crack ROBBINS (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're screwed on the trace -- he's on a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave and Robbins watch Sabatini work the comm console. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play the tape back. I might be able to pull the electronic serial number out of the subcarrier. CARSON (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask Dave if he knows how to find the phone's serial number. ROBBINS (smiles; into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, great idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambassador Han turns on the TV to channel 4.

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: It's the same medical SOAP that's on at the apartment -- DOCTOR and NURSE are screwing in a deserted operating roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal is standing in the kitchenette, pointing a DIGITAL CAMERA at the family. It FLASHES as he takes a picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a cable running from Javal's computer to his cel phone. He hooks another cable to the digital camera, and IMAGE appears on the screen of his laptop. He clicks on "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stares expectantly at the TV. They turn as the f machine on the credenza RINGS. An IMAGE begins to emerge the machine: the picture from Javal's digital camera.

dialogues.speaker: FAXED PICTURE
dialogues.text: It shows the Han family sitting in their booby-trapped ch in front of the TV. The explosives and the electronics ar clearly visible atop the set, as is the program on the TV CARSON (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, those're explosives! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the TV -- this was just taken.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: A second page on the fax begins to come through. As it do the telephone RINGS. Carson and Colonel Lee both go for t extension near the sofa; Carson grabs it first. Ambassado picks up the phone on his desk. JAVAL (VO) (thru phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must surely be several people in the room; you may put me on the speakerbox if you wish. Ambassador Han clicks on the SPEAKERBOX. Carson and the o look at the second faxed page: a list of instructions. JAVAL (VO) (continuing; thru speakerbox)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not a terrorist. Your countries' political posturing means nothing to me. So do not waste time trying to negotiate. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Federal Reserve Bank of Los Angeles can furnish ten million dollars U.S. by 2:00 PM. The required denominations are in the instructions, as is the method of packaging. Be in your car at 3:00 PM, and drive north on Highland Avenue. I will call with where to leave the money, which you will do at 3:30. If I am unmolested, I will call again at 4:00 with the family's location and the method for removing them from their... predicament. Could you please refer to page one? (they look at the photo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any deviation from these instructions and my device will fulfill its function at exactly 5:00 PM. CLICK. Ambassador Han looks around, feeling totally helpl Carson says nothing, trying not to show how uneasy he fee AMBASSADOR HAN (to Walther)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P'yГљngyang must approve the ransom... WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. The FBI's top Hostage Negotiator is on the way -- CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Goddamn Negotiator's the last thing we need! This asshole sound like he was interested in bargaining? Walther glares at Carson, then continues to Ambassador Ha WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have people who are experts in these situations. We really feel it would be best if you let them coordinate everything... Numb, Ambassador Han nods. WALTHER (continuing; to Carson)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get on it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbins, Sabatini and Dave look up as Carson and Walther CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You're gonna just pay up, count on his good nature to return the family?! WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the President's intention to keep this quiet, move forward with the Summit, and work with the North Koreans. Jesus, you've already embarrassed the shit out of us over the phone surveillance -- CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- They know their phones are tapped! They tap our fucking phones! WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the point! The point is not acknowledging it! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got an international incident brewing, with a country we were practically at war with last year! Our best Negotiator is gonna run point. If you got a problem, you can take the goddamn rest of the day off. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Consulate is my responsibility. WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not any more. Carson is stunned. (OS), we hear a CHOPPER approaching. WALTHER (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the Negotiator. You do the briefing. Carson shoots a disgusted look at the others, then leaves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson turns off the Beach Boys SONG on the TV behind him Holding Javal's faxes, he's facing Ambassador Han, Colone and the Hostage Negotiator (whom we don't yet see.) CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Our worst enemy'll be the city. There are events gearing up all around town, and a dozen world leaders arriving. Add the Friday rush hour and usual L.A. bad behavior and it'll be a nightmare out there by 3 PM. It all works to the advantage of the kidnapper, hinders our pursuit efforts... (frowns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't agree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Negotiator stands and takes the faxes from Carson. It's Miranda, his wife. Her FBI shield-holder is folded o the breast pocket of her jacket. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm wondering whether to believe him when he says he's strictly motivated by money. CARSON (grabs faxes back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see one word of Peoples'- Liberation, Holy-Jihad, Revolutionary whatever-it-is-we're-pissed-off-about- this-week bullshit in this entire letter? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still want to check the MO against known politicals, terrorists -- CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Already doing it. We're coordinating with the Secret Service, the NSA and the CIA. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have someone talk to the LAPD, give them a cover story for the media about the crash on La Cienega. Walther comes in and looks at Carson. WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me Doctor Knoll is your wife?! This surprises Ambassador Han and Colonel Lee. CARSON (while looking at Miranda)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she'd changed her name when we got married, I wouldn't have to. MIRANDA (to Carson)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so enjoying this opportunity to finally work together... WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, forget I asked. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cash will be here in an hour. (to Miranda)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any thoughts on the kidnapper's thoughts? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything indicates he's working alone. And his concerns do seem to be solely about the money... so I agree that he's only using the Summit and the tension with North Korea to create extreme motivation to pay the ransom. COLONEL LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will bring the money to him. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ass. COLONEL LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hostages are citizens of the People's Republic of Korea -- CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Hey, do I go to the torture chambers in your prisons, tell you how to do your job? WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, you're outta here! Is this the same insubordinate crap you pulled at Beverly Thrift? Carson glares coldly at Walther. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll coordinate the drop. AMBASSADOR HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps that is better. Inspector Carson knows the terrain -- COLONEL LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Then he can come with me. Walther looks at Miranda. She nods her assent. WALTHER (firm; to Carson)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's settled. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sucks. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it means we can get on with it. The Americans leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still fuming, Carson walks ahead. Miranda pulls Walther a MIRANDA (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get one thing straight, Mr. Walther. If the Bureau had listened to Pete, Beverly Thrift never would've happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands shaking with nerve- and speed-induced jitters, Java turns two switches on the unit atop the TV. Two LED reado light up: one shows the current time -- 2:30 PM -- the ot is fixed at 5:00 PM. Below, the TV is still on. Javal flips the channels, stopping at a rerun of "Lifesty of the Rich and Famous." He suppresses a gleeful giggle. JAVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's more like it... He checks the contents of his prescription bottle. Two pi He takes one, stuffs the bottle in his pocket, and leaves EXT.  PГ­YВіNGYANG, NORTH KOREA - DAY SUPER: PГ­yГљngyang. Capitol of North Korea. Poster city for the charms of Communism: dreary, crumblin gray, stifling, hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the main government offices, a meeting of ten overly- decorated MILITARY MEN and their SUPPORT STAFFS. Sour GENERAL KAI (50's) is ARGUING heatedly in KOREAN wit aged MODERATE GENERAL. The weak-willed PREMIER OF NORTH K sits up front and listens passively. An ARMY MAJOR sitting behind General Kai stands and slips the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crouched behind an air-conditioning unit, the Major, an American Operative, speaks in UNACCENTED ENGLISH into a s UPLINK DEVICE, disguised to look like a palmtop computer. OPERATIVE (into uplink device)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...They've got the Premier agreeing to the hard-line position -- He hears footsteps approaching (OS). OPERATIVE (continuing; sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More to follow... He angles skyward a tiny dish-shaped antenna on the Devic its screen it says COMPRESSING... SCRAMBLING... UPLINKING After it's finished, the Operative snaps it closed and pu into a false bottom in his attachГ€ case. He disappears j before a GUARD rounds the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Welcome Pacific Partners" banners hang everywhere. WORKERS and CATERERS prepare for the various parties and events around town. COPS and PRIVATE SECURITY do their be keep traffic moving, but it's already getting congested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave stares at his computer, looking through a DATABASE o kidnappers and their modus operandi. He rubs his eyes. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to be home by now, take the kids to the rally in Boyle Heights. SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a cabin in Big Bear. By now, L.A. was supposed to be a brown blotch in the rear-view mirror. She's helping Walther stack packs of THOUSAND-DOLLAR-BILL into a series of small plastic bags, tying each one off w it's the size of a brick. They then put the individual ba into two larger bags. Robbins rubber-bands a matchbook-sized HOMING TRANSMITTER between two packs of cash. He then hollows out a dime-siz space inside a different pack of money with a razor knife He puts a tiny, SECOND homing transmitter in the space. C checks some hand-held receivers. Miranda crosses to him. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll expect a homing device -- CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I expect him to expect it. He'll check the cash with an RF detector... (re larger transmitter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning he'll find this one. (re smaller transmitter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This only has a quarter-mile range, but on a frequency too low to detect. (turns off receiver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I doubt the asshole will have an X-ray machine or a metal detector. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why must you always refer generically to criminals as "assholes?" CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh, you're right. It could undermine their self-esteem and spoil their chances for rehabilitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been reading my magazines in the bathroom again? She returns to listening to an AUDIO TAPE: JAVAL (VO) (thru recorder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And my device will fulfill its function at exactly 5:00 PM..." MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's really exhibiting pressured speech... big effort here to sound calm. Same with his vocabulary... if he were in control, he wouldn't feel such a need to sound that way. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me if we can use it. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we needle him he could get sloppy and give us an opening, but I'm not going to risk it. This is the worst kind of perpetrator: anything makes him deviate from his carefully- scripted plan, he could become extremely volatile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During this, Colonel Lee stands in a window on the top fl pointing a LASER EAVESDROPPING UNIT at the FBI guardhouse MIRANDA (VO) (thru headphones)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have back-up if the bleeper fails? CARSON (VO) (thru headphones)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing but physical surveillance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's real important we don't lose him. He didn't go through all the trouble of designing that bomb not to use it. Carson looks at her as the thought of it hits him. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it ain't gonna happen. (beat; sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The National Security Council: VICE PRESIDENT, SECRETARIE DEFENSE, STATE, CHIEFS of the FBI, CIA and NSA -- sit nervously around a table, facing a video conferencing set The President, in Air Force One, APPEARS on it. PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is the big crisis? SECRETARY OF STATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just received a missive from the North Korean attachГ€. They say the kidnapping is a U.S. plot to provoke and humiliate them during the Summit. PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. They're just ticked because we don't want the Chinese dragging their asses into the treaty talks. The SENIOR INTELLIGENCE OFFICER refers to his notes. INTELLIGENCE OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a covert operative in place. He reports the hard-liners and moderates in the High Command are arguing about how to respond, should the Premier's niece and her children should be killed. PRESIDENT (scowls; thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Respond?! Christ. What about the damn Premier? SECRETARY OF STATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's weak. He has to look tough to save face, keep control of hard- liners... otherwise he risks a coup. CIA CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is a real possibility. Most of those old-fart Generals don't want to -more- CIA CHIEF (Cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: be part of the Summit any more than we want them to. They're mad as hell he even talked to the Chinese. PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to deal with this right now! Get our diplomats on it. Tell the North we'll pay the ransom for 'em... Placate 'em! And make damn sure we get that family back in one piece. Who's in charge in L.A.? FBI CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bureau, Sir. We have a crack team in place. SECRETARY OF STATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a Diplomatic Liaison from State, too. CIA CHIEF (to FBI Chief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your man stationed at the Consulate... (refers to notes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson? He was demoted from the FBI Hostage Program, couple years back. And this did happen on his watch... FBI CHIEF (irritated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way he could've prevented this abduction! Besides, I've got one of my top Negotiators in charge -- PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Whatever. I want a total news blackout and I want this over with, quickly! Without giving those Commie little bastards any excuse to shit all over my Summit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, the grandfather clock in the foyer CHIMES THREE T Colonel Lee, carrying an AMD-74 machine gun, goes to get driver's side of the second armored Mercedes, but Carson already there. Grumbling, he crosses to the passenger's s Carson drives off just a moment before Colonel Lee is completely in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mercedes crosses Melrose, going into Hollywood. The t is all done up with posters and banners. Robbins and Walther follow a block behind the Mercedes in unmarked car; Sabatini and Dave drive ahead in Dave's Dod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda, Ambassador Han, and Lisa's father (the cussing J Owner) wait by the phone. Miranda smiles reassuringly at two nervous fathers. The phone RINGS; she picks it up. MIRANDA (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, please go ahead... JAVAL (VO) (long beat; thru phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... this must be one of those professionals -- MIRANDA (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm only here to see that everyone gets what they want -- JAVAL (VO) (thru phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I've got my shotgun in little Lisa's mouth, and I will pull the trigger in five seconds unless you put the Ambassador on the phone. Miranda hands the phone to Ambassador Han.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the two-way radio in Carson's pocket: MIRANDA (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drop is at the DeMille barn, across from the Hollywood Bowl. You're to leave the money in the center of the parking lot. CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... no way we can set up a stake- out in... -more- CARSON (Cont'd) (checks watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four minutes. Call the Park Rangers at the Bowl. Have them clear the area of civilians. MIRANDA (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, Pete... we're dealing with a customer with a lot of rage. CARSON (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must've bought a house same time we did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbins and Walther are inching along in traffic on Highl near Hollywood Blvd. Elsewhere, we see unmarked police and government cars cru around, dropping off disguised FOOT-SURVEILLANCE OFFICERS

dialogues.speaker: A BIKER CLUB
dialogues.text: of twenty aging, weekend-warriors, all on custom Harleys, from the Boulevard onto Highland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson drives the Mercedes into the entrance of the Holly Museum Park. Carson stops in front of a yellow barn with sign atop it: "Jesse Lasky Famous Players."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still disguised as an ice-cream truck, the van is parked across Highland by the entrance to the Hollywood Bowl, wh Summit-related concert is being readied. Javal watches the Mercedes, and takes his last pill. He's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Lee grabs the two large plastic bags full of mone from the back seat, opens his door, and drops them onto t pavement. Carson looks around. CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's about a hundred ways he can scurry off like a cockroach from here... So spread out. Colonel Lee checks their BEEPING homing receiver. Carson a left onto Highland, going back the way he came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave holds their homing receiver. Sabatini, behind the wh smacks his arm and points ahead:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal's van drives into the parking lot, and stops right the bags of money. DAVE (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our boy's in a fuckin' ice cream truck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sabatini and Dave watch Javal's van through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal, sweating and shaking, quickly runs a metal-detecto wand over each of the individual bags of money. One of th makes the speaker in the wand handle WHINE.

dialogues.speaker: DEMILLE BARN
dialogues.text: The van pulls away. Dave glances at the homing receiver. The signal isn't mov He looks up... Two of the small bags of money are sitting on the pavemen DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch! (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He found the bleepers -- both of them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! Okay, stay back. It's not like he'll be hard to see in that truck. Which way's he heading? DAVE (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toward the freeway. Carson hangs a U-turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the complex intersection where Highland ends at the 10 Javal bears to the right, toward the South on-ramp. Sabatini and Dave follow a few cars behind as he gets on Suddenly, he scoots over to the shoulder and slams the va into REVERSE. He backs off the on-ramp, past a row of ang drivers, passing by Sabatini and Dave. Peeling in reverse onto Highland, Javal stomps on the bra The snap buckles holding the ice-cream-truck superstructu around his van BREAK APART, and the whole thing slides of blocking Sabatini's way. Javal drives forward again, this time getting onto the 10 North on-ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda looks at Ambassador Han and Lisa's father while anxiously clutching her two-way radio. MIRANDA (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? CARSON (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're made! Gotta grab him! MIRANDA (beat; into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... Carefully...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson follows Javal onto the freeway. Colonel Lee grabs AMD-74 machine gun. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it! We need him alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Lee leans out and SHOOTS Javal's rear tires out. The van drives erratically, held in its lane by bumping against the cars around it. Carson pulls up closer... Suddenly, the rear doors of the van burst open... And Javal flies out, riding a motorcycle. He's got the mo stuffed into two big, chaps-sized SADDLEBAGS slung over t back of the machine. He straddles the lanes, going against traffic, riding lik maniac back the way he came. Carson watches him in the rear-view... and speeds up, dri away from him. COLONEL LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around! But Carson hugs the shoulder, moving through the heavy traffic, until he spots what he was looking for: The Biker Club, riding in formation up ahead. Carson cuts in front of them and slams on the brakes. He out and grabs one of the Biker's machines by the handleba wrestling it to a stop. While pulling its BURLY OWNER off CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI. Call our office, they'll take care of you. Meanwhile, the other BIKERS have come to help their frien They pull guns, knives, chains... They're stopped by Sabatini, who appears holding her MP-5 machine pistol. The Biker yells at Carson as he drives wa BIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a taxpayer! I'm a goddamn dentist!

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LEE
dialogues.text: gets in the driver's seat of the Mercedes and turns it ar

dialogues.speaker: JAVAL
dialogues.text: continues down the freeway on his bike, straddling lanes, driving the wrong way, retracing his route back to Highla leaving CAR HORNS, CURSING, and COLLISIONS in his wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When everyone thinks they've seen it all, here comes anot mad biker -- Carson -- riding against traffic in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal rides against traffic down the Cahuenga on-ramp, th jumps the divider, runs the light crossing Highland, and into the southbound lanes. He just misses a BUS, nearly wiping out. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't kill yourself, you piece of shit... Carson fishes out his two-way. CARSON (continuing; into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helicopter or two would be nice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listening to the two-way, Miranda tries to follow the act MIRANDA (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love to be in the loop on this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speeding up, Carson precariously cuts in between traffic. CARSON (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just now, dear... Seeing Carson approaching on his right, Javal pulls his B shotgun from one of the saddlebags. He rests the barrel o arm and FIRES a blinding-white load of magnesium at Carso Carson grabs the brake handles to slow down, and the BLAS crosses just in front of him. A few BURNING pieces pepper front fender of the bike, but the bulk HITS the concrete deco statue in the entrance to the Hollywood Bowl. The st shatters into a million FLAMING fragments. CARSON (continuing; grumbling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I coulda had a ranch... maybe some horses... but no, we moved to L.A.

dialogues.speaker: JAVAL
dialogues.text: speeds up. A car passing on the right BUMPS him. Javal gr for the handlebar to stabilize himself, DROPPING the shot A HELICOPTER appears, and flies just above him. Then, spotting some police cars ahead, he quickly hangs a right, ducking onto Alta Loma Terrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson stops at the entrance to the winding, hillside neighborhood, accessible only by footpaths. The area is covered by thick foliage, hiding Javal from the helicopte Carson revs down so he can listen for Javal's machine. He HEARS it up above and takes off, up a steep flight of sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal has reached the summit, only to find he's boxed in. can either turn around, or take the neighborhood's unique outdoor elevator, housed in a free-standing, three-story concrete tower. He jumps off his bike. Carrying the saddlebags, he runs i the elevator -- but it needs a key to operate. Javal comes back out, panicking.  He HEARS Carson coming the hill. He spots a GARDENER watering nearby with a hose

dialogues.speaker: CARSON
dialogues.text: as he reaches the summit. He sees Javal's motorcycle, abandoned, lying on its side... And then he sees the Gardener, sprawled on the ground, a BULLET HOLE in the center of his forehead. Carson turns off his motorcycle and pulls out his Sig 9mm moves slowly toward the elevator tower and looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The casement window in the back of the tower is broken. O of the gardener's hose is tied to a grate, and the hose i hanging through the broken window. Carson looks out the window as Javal climbs down the outs the tower on the hose to High Tower Drive, the street bel CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on foot, at the base of the elevator tower! But just as Carson is about to climb down the hose...
