dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal spots a COLLEGE GIRL backing a tiny Geo out of her garage. He rips her out of the car, jumps in and tears aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson jumps back on his motorcycle and starts it up. CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit! He's in a blue Geo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Geo, Javal drives out onto Highland. He muscles hi through traffic, then cuts across to Franklin. Behind him, Robbins and Walther drive along the divider l On the bike, Carson emerges from Alta Loma, joining Sabat and Dave in Dave's Dodge and Colonel Lee in the Mercedes they all try to catch up to Javal. The helicopter flies ahead, then disappears past the hill below Franklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal hangs a hard right off of Franklin onto Vine, putti him on top of a hill that drops down to Sunset. Carson and Colonel Lee close in on the Geo. Suddenly, the helicopter RISES UP from the bottom of the It's less than fifty feet in front of Javal, at eye level Javal FIRES at the copter with his Beretta. Colonel Lee indiscriminately FIRES his machine gun at the Carson SHOUTS at Colonel Lee, furious at his carelessness

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Lee's BULLETS trace across the cockpit of the helicopter; one hits the PILOT in the neck. Clutching it one hand, the Pilot loses control of the copter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone on the road scatters to get out of the copter's It appears as though it's going to crash onto the street, it gains altitude, GYRATING wildly just above the Geo. Javal tries to move away, but one of its landing runners SMASHES through the top of the windshield, WEDGING itself against the inside of the Geo's roof. Snared, the little Geo is LIFTED off the ground -- instan too high for a terrified Javal to escape from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wounded Pilot, barely conscious, searches for safe ar set down -- but there are cars and people everywhere. The Pilot wrestles his stick; his copter is almost imposs to control with the car hanging from it. He's fading...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The copter and Geo lurch over and past the round Capitol Records building, KNOCKING the spindle off the top of it. The impact further destabilizes the copter's flight. It's heading right toward the 20-story Sunset Vine Tower, at t bottom of the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal, trapped inside, looks through the windshield as th glass and steel side of the tower looms closer. He SCREAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The copter and the Geo CRASH into the side of the Tower, floors up. Glass blows out in all directions; the rotor shatters; office furnishings are blown through the hole l backwash. The Geo hangs passenger's side down from the runner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the series of jerking, slipping MOVEMENTS, it is cle the copter is not going to stay where it is for long. The Geo's passenger side door pops open. Javal, panting w fear, jimmies his foot against the dashboard and holds th steering wheel to keep from falling out.

dialogues.speaker: VEHICLES BELOW
dialogues.text: In the clog of traffic, cars swerve away, rapidly reverse anything to get away from the area below the impact.

dialogues.speaker: JAVAL
dialogues.text: reacts to another SLIP. The big saddlebags of money on th seat start to slide toward the open door. He gingerly reaches over to grab them... the copter SHIFT again... he loses his grip... And, clutching the saddlebags, he TOPPLES out of the car. We stay with him as he FALLS 12 stories, SCREAMING... Then LANDING on top of a parking meter. It RIPS though hi chest and he hits the sidewalk with a wet THUD.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. VINE AND SUNSET
dialogues.text: Carson rushes across the street to Javal's body. The teet copter and Geo are right above it. Grimacing, Carson tries to lift Javal's body up off the parking meter, but it's messy, slippery work... Unable to move the body, Carson quickly searches its pock All he finds is the now-empty prescription bottle. Above, the copter GROANS... it's about to come loose... Carson pulls out his Sig 9mm and FIRES several times at Javal's right wrist, then TEARS the HAND off the body. With a loud WRENCHING of metal, the copter and Geo break from the building. Carson grabs the saddlebags and runs like hell across the street, diving for cover behind a car.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND CARSON
dialogues.text: the copter and Geo crash to the sidewalk and EXPLODE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooty, covered in Javal's blood, Carson crosses to the ot He throws Walther the saddlebags and Sabatini the severed CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerprint it. (to Walther)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not gonna tell us where to find the hostages... -more- CARSON (Cont'd) (looks at watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning we got exactly 80 minutes to figure it out for ourselves. WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figure it out?! With what?! CARSON (ignores him; into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda! We need a copter, pronto! (to Robbins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back to his van. There were no plates, but check the VIN, look it over, then meet us at the Consulate. Robbins is still trying to process what just happened. CARSON (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock reads 3:50 PM. Carson, Miranda, Robbins, Sabati Ambassador Han and Colonel Lee are all TALKING at once. CARSON (to Walther)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Scrounge us some bodies: National Guard, State Troopers, CHPs, local PD's, meter maids -- WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- They're gonna search the whole city in a goddamn hour..?! CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't need you to tell me how fucked we are! WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!! Every time you're on a case something explodes! Carson looks like he's going to explode. Before he can re MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! The clock's running! Arguing is a luxury we can't afford! -more- MIRANDA (Cont'd) (looks at Carson)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's done is done. There'll be plenty of time to point fingers later. Carson would love to get into it, but he lets it slide. H looks Sabatini, wandering aimlessly with Javal's severed SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some fuckin' ink!! Carson grabs one of the expensive pens from Ambassador Ha desk, SNAPS it in half, and hands it to her. In the b.g. she stands at the credenza, inks the hand's f and thumb and rolls them onto a piece of letterhead paper AMBASSADOR HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is impossible! How can you even begin to find them? Good question. All eyes go to Miranda. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the normal procedure is to negotiate with the perpetrator... Her head is spinning. She looks at Carson. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take stock. We've got a picture of where he hid the family, and recordings of his calls -- MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- That's right! We can send them to our experts for analysis... CARSON (to Ambassador Han)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same with his fingerprints. But that means we need high-quality image and data transmission. We can piss away ten minutes coptering this shit to our offices in Westwood, or we can use your surveillance equipment. COLONEL LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no surveillance equipment. This is a diplomatic facility -- CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You want to play games, fine. He turns to go. Ambassador Han turns to Colonel Lee. AMBASSADOR HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the converted attic, several North Korean ESPIONAGE AG monitor military and police frequencies, downlinks from r wiretaps and surveillance units; short-wave, cellular, et Their equipment, being of Chinese and Iranian manufacture hardly cutting-edge technology. Colonel Lee and Ambassador Han enter. The Espionage Agent surprised when Carson, Miranda, Walther and Sabatini foll Walther looks around, amazed. Carson grabs a pair of head CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: South Korean Consulate's just down the street -- want to take a listen? Colonel Lee pulls the phones away from him. Carson takes the page with the fingerprints from Sabatini Espionage Agents back away from her and Javal's hand. CARSON (continuing; re hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shitcan that thing, will you?! She looks around. Then, shrugging, she tosses it into a wastepaper basket. CARSON (continuing; to Colonel Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a digital scanner? COLONEL LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Analog. CARSON (looks equipment over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might want to drop a few bucks at Radio Shack and get with the decade. (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave -- get in here. Bring your computer, a city map, and the tapes of the ransom calls. DAVE (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my way... He's also HEARD, faintly, through the laser eavesdropping by the window. Carson notices, but doesn't comment. MIRANDA (to Colonel Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, you saw the perp. Describe him to the Ambassador, see if it's anyone he knows. Colonel Lee begrudgingly obliges. Carson dials a phone. CARSON (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Carson in L.A. There's a set of prints coming over. Narrow the search criteria: Male, thirties, Caucasian... French, Belgian, Swiss, maybe Canadian. Try kidnappers and bombers first. We need an answer in fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI headquarters, with the Washington Monument in the b.g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TECHNICIAN, wearing thick glasses, sits in front of a h resolution computer monitor. FINGERPRINT TECH (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That yellow air out there finally rot your brain?! It's impossible! CARSON (VO) (thru phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dazzle me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson clicks off the phone, then, as he dials another nu CARSON (to Walther)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got one of the best sound guys right here in town... (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newman in Audio Analysis... DAVE (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newman's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave comes into the room. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quit, couple weeks ago. Opened a bed and breakfast in Wyoming. Carson looks at Miranda and hangs up the phone. DAVE (continuing; looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn... they get HBO? I'd sure like to see the fight tonight. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get those tapes transferred to a sound guy. We need ambient and background analysis, the whole enchilada. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enchilada -- you saying that because I'm Mexican? CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... 'cause you're fat. MIRANDA (picks up Javal's fax)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photo enhancement... Isn't there some amazing tech with the LAPD -- DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Bronsky. Transferred to Seattle PD a month ago. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus H. Christ... SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd send it to Langley. Let the CIA earn their keep. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. Carson tosses Javal's bloody, unlabeled prescription bott Miranda. She looks it over, runs her finger inside, taste dust on her fingertip. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Given his behavior, this orange residue... I'd say Desoxyn, 25 mg. Amphetamines. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any significance? MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's consistent with the lone wolf scenario: A handful of these is pure bravery-in-a-bottle, 'til the psychosis and paranoia kick in. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could check pharmacy records, on the remote chance he got them legally... if we had a couple of weeks, that is. CARSON (to Sabatini)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the Bureau on it. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. It's a waste of manpower. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, goddammit, you start skipping no-chance-in-hell leads, we can all quit and go to the beach right now. Sabatini looks at them -- which will it be? Miranda frown nods her okay, then spreads the L.A. map out on the table CARSON (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabbed the family at 8:30. The last certain visual we had was just before his van went into the alley on La Cienega at 8:42. He called the Consulate at 9:30. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That gives him about fifty minutes to get to his location, move and secure the hostages, and activate his time bomb. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He probably waited a while to pad the time -- he wanted us know the family was still alive... (sotto; re Koreans)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...So these crazy bastards wouldn't throw a premature shit hemorrhage, but he didn't want to call too soon, either. I say they're within 15 to 20 minutes, via surface streets, of where we last saw them. He draws a circle on the city map: Beverly Hills to downt Hollywood to Inglewood. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most densely-populated part of the L.A. basin. This narrows it down to about 200,000 dwellings. A beat while this sinks in. MIRANDA (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was traveling west -- CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Bet he doubled back. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, that's total conjecture -- SABATINI (re Carson)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'd trust his instincts when dealing with maniacs. He is deeply disturbed. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is smoking. Their tension has increased tenfold we last saw them. The President, SEEN through the video s is pacing on Air Force One. SECRETARY OF STATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...North Koreans have gone ballistic, accusing us of botching the ransom drop on purpose. SECRETARY OF DEFENSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still harping on that "American plot" nonsense. PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning? SECRETARY OF DEFENSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say the death of the Premier's niece and her family would justify immediate retaliation. PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they out of their fuckin' minds?! What kind of retaliation? Everyone in the room looks at one another. CIA CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're threatening to pull a Saddam Hussein: remember the Scuds he lobbed at Jerusalem during Desert Storm? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're talking about firing a missile into Los Angeles -- PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A goddamn WHAT?? INTELLIGENCE OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best guess is an AS-15, medium-range cruise -- their version of our Tomahawk, launched from offshore. SECRETARY OF DEFENSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AS-15 is gyro-guided. It will find the city, but it's not too accurate beyond that. VICE PRESIDENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, for their purposes it's perfect: Hit somewhere in L.A., take out a city block or two... SECRETARY OF STATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the eyes of the world it's a measured response -- like what Reagan did to Qaddafi. But actually striking at an American city would be a huge psychological victory for them. PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe I'm hearing this! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if we know it's coming, we can knock it out of the fuckin' sky! SECRETARY OF DEFENSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These weapons fly subsonically, below radar... we don't have the defenses in place... If we'd had the time to deploy a string of Patriot anti- missile batteries across the coast -- PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You're saying we got all this lousy hardware and can't stop one goddamn missile?? Everyone's silence answers his question. PRESIDENT (continuing; thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want an immediate search for all ships within range. FBI CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better inform the other leaders, stall on the Summit -- PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no reason to panic yet -- they can't launch until after the family's confirmed dead! CIA CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afraid that's not the case... The Intelligence Officer illustrates his explanation with FOOTAGE and DIAGRAMS on a nearby COMPUTER SCREEN: INTELLIGENCE OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The North Korean Premier holds what we call a "Brinksman Switch." He's able to destroy a missile in flight, right up to the moment before it achieves its target. CIA CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Op says they've timed their retaliation to hit right after 5:00. FBI CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if the family turns up okay, they'll just make it self-destruct. PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! I really don't need this today! VICE PRESIDENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're forgetting one thing here: the family. Intelligence is sure the North will abort their attack if Mrs. Han and her kids are safely returned? CIA CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Their whole game depends on claiming a legitimate provocation. SECRETARY OF DEFENSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, we should let them know there'd be a response... if it comes to it. PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to turn 'em into a radioactive parking lot. SECRETARY OF STATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the problem: we can't. We're the last superpower. Our hands are tied by politics, alliances, goddamn stacks of treaties... most we could do is give 'em a "measured response" back again, or everyone starts crying that we're the bullies. SECRETARY OF DEFENSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, I miss the Cold War. Russians wouldn't have dreamt of pulling a stunt like this. PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, the North drops one in my fuckin' city, I'm dropping ten in theirs. Get some bombers in the air. And don't tell me any more bad news!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbins stands by Javal's van, on the shoulder of the fre ROBBINS (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Phone company decal's a fake. DMV says the van was purchased a week ago from a private party in Santa Monica. I called 'em; they said the guy paid cash, and he fits our boy's description. Signed the name "Douglas McArthur" to the Transfer of Title.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute. (to Miranda)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He signed the name of the Allied Commander during the Korean War. Maybe he was a political. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The phony ice cream truck, the booby-trapped chairs... he could've -more- MIRANDA (Cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: done it without half that stuff. But this was going to be the score of a lifetime... he was showing off. CARSON (to Dave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got those kinds of skills: Electronics, vehicle customizing, computers, explosives? DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Military. Cop, maybe. Shit, your average high-school student if they're so inclined. My guess is our perp used off-the-shelf equipment for everything except the C-4, and that's only slightly harder to get than crack or heroin, if you know who to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAPD headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone who can be spared, even moth-eaten SUPPORT PERSO hustle through the maze of hallways and get into waiting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From up here, it looks like the city is one big block par Accordingly, traffic is heavy and unpleasant. BOBBI (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, L.A., I know we're about to have quite a party out there, but don't forget the Golden Rule on the roadways... News time is 3:59...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobbi looks into the TV camera, dripping with sincerity. BOBBI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Bobbi Marchfelder, your Eye in the Sky... back to you, Brent... The red light on the camera goes off. Bobbi turns to the BOBBI (continuing; furious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, dickhead... I was backlit that entire segment! (as if to a child)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep... the sun... to my left!! The Cameraman and the Pilot sigh at each other. BOBBI (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's new on the kidnapping rumor? CAMERAMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nada. Total news blackout. BOBBI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back over the hill. NEWS PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the valley traffic report in fifteen -- BOBBI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- "Stalled vehicle! One lane closed! Sig alert..!" I'll improvise! She takes an industrial-sized bottle of Mylanta out of he purse. It's fitted with a water-bottle DRINKING SPOUT. Sh takes a huge swig and grimaces. BOBBI (continuing; to Cameraman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you lookin' at? I was the morning anchor in Houston! And I'm one break away from getting out of this stupid fuckin' whirlybird!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Han family sits in their booby-trapped chairs. Joy carefully turns to her mother. JOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why us? MRS. HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard him -- for money. JOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if something goes wrong? MRS. HAN (firmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson grabs his FBI blazer off the back of a chair. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the kidnapping site. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to the witnesses. Colonel Lee also heads for the door. Carson looks at him. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, we'll hire a bus. They leave. Dave, meanwhile, paces, phone in hand. DAVE (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I know it's privileged information, goddammit! Lemme talk to a supervisor... You are a supervisor... Lemme talk to your goddamn supervisor... I told you, I'm with the FBI... (to Sabatini)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cellular company says he was using a phone with a cloned number. SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big surprise. Have 'em send a list of the numbers called on the account. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm trying to get. They're saying I need a subpoena. (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't put me on hold... Don't... (pulls phone from his ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm listening to Michael fuckin' Bolton! SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walther! Get on the horn to Justice and deal with this!

dialogues.speaker: FISHING TRAWLER
dialogues.text: SUPER: Pacific Ocean. 500 miles west-northwest of Los Ang We FIND a nondescript commercial fishing vessel. Up top, Asian "FISHERMEN" crank in and stow their nets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming closer, we see it's actually a disguised North Kor SPY VESSEL. Several MEN, working under hanging tarps, sec a 20-foot-long missile launching track to the bow. Two MISSILE EXPERTS install a green, cone-shaped WARHEAD high explosives onto the nose of a 23-foot-long, short-wi CRUISE MISSILE. They wait for the CAPTAIN's orders...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbins is in Javal's van, examining the innards of the r control boxes. He picks up his radio. ROBBINS (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of the components are made by the same manufacturer -- a car security company. CARSON (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jump a copter to the Consulate. See if the manufacturer sells to the public. Find out what shops use their stuff; put people on the phones with a description of the perp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the kidnapping site, the intersection is blocked off w yellow police tape. Several LAPD cruisers are parked near Some COPS are interviewing the Carpool Lady. Despite this, the neighborhood's bazaar -- a sidewalk sal with MUSIC, food vendors, etc. -- has half-heartedly begu The government helicopter HOVERS and Carson helps Miranda down a long chain ladder. Colonel Lee follows impatiently

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson uncovers the bodies of the Driver and the Motorist lying on the sidewalk. He grimaces. Colonel Lee does not. Miranda wants to look, but Carson drops the cover. She pi it up, then turns away in horror. A young BLACK COP crosses to them. He's holding a plastic with a spent shotgun shell in it. YOUNG COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector! Look at this... (reads from shell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon's Breath..?" CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve-gauge shell filled with magnesium and ignition powder. Shit's worse than napalm -- Geneva Convention outlawed it for warfare. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how did he get it? CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy -- you can buy 'em mail order. (looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the Consulate's car? YOUNG COP (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... apparently it was stolen... COLONEL LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stolen!? What is it with you people -- YOUNG COP (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What's this "you people" shit? CARSON (to Colonel Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! MIRANDA (aside; to Young Cop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He means all of us "you people." CARSON (to Young Cop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find it! How many bulletproof Mercedes could be cruising around Crenshaw? YOUNG COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised... CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this fuckin' town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The North Korean COMMUNICATIONS OFFICER puts down his headphones and hurries on deck to the Captain. It's time. Suddenly, a BEARDED CREWMAN crosses to the Captain. He ca SHOOTS him and the FIRST MATE. The rest of the Crew is shocked. Holding his pistol on th Crew, the Bearded Crewman nods at the Missile Experts. Saluting, they remove the green warhead from the missile. Two OTHER CONSPIRATORS, carrying a metal locker, appear f below deck. The Crew murmurs nervously as they remove fro locker a red warhead and attach it to the missile. Finishing, one of the Experts pushes the firing trigger a the missile WHOOSHES from its launching pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The government helicopter touches down behind the Consula

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambassador Han, Walther and Sabatini are looking at a ser of high-definition faxes spread out on a table. Carson, Miranda and Colonel Lee hurry back in. Disgusted, Carson throws his jacket on a chair. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasted trip: Witnesses say he was working alone, and he was a vicious son of a bitch. Old news. COLONEL LEE (to Ambassador Han)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And our car was stolen. AMBASSADOR HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt safer when I was the Ambassador to Libya. SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Image enhancements came back.

dialogues.speaker: PICTURES
dialogues.text: The CIA technicians have enlarged and enhanced every part the fax deemed significant, in individual blowups.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Colonel Lee is standing right beside Carson, leaning over look at the pictures. Carson looks at him, irritated. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We going steady? SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun position tells us the windows are facing northeast. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the best -- look at the glass on the prints hanging in the background. There's a reflection of a reflection, out on the street: the corner of a billboard. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the wheel of a car. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We talked about these billboards, when we were car shopping! Four- door... they make a wagon, too. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something Japanese... God, what was it? Toyota... Mazda... Honda... You thought it had no character. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that about all of them. C'mon, think, dammit!! MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think!! You were there, too! They're stumped, and bitterly frustrated. To Sabatini: CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the outdoor advertising companies. Get the location of all the billboards for Japanese cars within our search parameters. Meanwhile, Dave and Robbins are calling car alarm shops: DAVE (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Peerless Auto Security. We need to know whether you've sold a large quantity of these components to any one customer, or whether you'd had any stolen recently... EXT.  PГ­YВіNGYANG, NORTH KOREA - ESTABLISHING - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Kai stands in hushed conversation with the Army M Operative and another trusted AIDE. The PHONE buzzes; the others leave the room before General Kai picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind closed doors, the Operative LISTENS to the phone c with an EAVESDROPPING RECEIVER. What he hears stuns him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Operative is in his hiding spot with his uplink devic OPERATIVE (urgently; into device)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Missile heading to L.A. has a Kipchak Warhead! Repeat: missile is Kipchak equipped! It was switched by order of -- A GUNSHOT rings out (OS), and the Operative's chest EXPLO in blood. He pitches forward... but presses the "transmit button on the uplink device before dying. On screen it says UPLINKING... (without scrambling)... th another GUNSHOT destroys it. Angry, General Kai steps INTO FRAME and kicks the Operati over with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Han and Joy sit motionless. Sam, on the other hand, trying not to squirm. Mrs. Han looks at him, angry. MRS. HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked you if you had to go... The family becomes aware of a shrill SOUND, (OS), distant first, but growing increasingly louder... The sound-level meters all begin to creep upward...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A team of GARDENERS has arrived on the property for their weekly mow, blow, and go. They have lawnmowers, edgers, b -- it's as NOISY as an aircraft carrier during takeoffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND is getting louder, and louder... JOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God... The meters are hovering just below the red...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: pivots his head and looks at the tiny microphone, no bigg than a pencil eraser, attached neatly to the headrest. He begins chewing his wad of GUM... leans in toward the microphone, his head obscuring what he's doing... He moves back and we see he's SEALED the front of the mic a small piece of the gum. And his meter drops to zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam tilts his head forward and bends his wrist upward so can get the rest of the gum out of his mouth. Then, while keeping pressure on the armrest with his elbow, he moves hand over to Mrs. Han. They can't quite reach each other. He FLICKS the piece of gum and she catches it. Meanwhile, the NOISE increases. The two meters peak into red... the yellow WARNING LIGHT begins to flash... Mrs. Han quickly puts the gum in her mouth, bites it in h and cautiously passes the remainder over to Joy. Joy puts the gum in her mouth. She tries to push it over mic, but her hair is in the way. She shakes her head; som hair strands remain, but she covers the mic just as the Gardeners' noise reaches a CRESCENDO... All three sound meters sit pinned to zero. The yellow lig stops flashing. Sam, sweating, looks at his mother and sister... and star laughing. They join him: a celebration for a small victor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock on the wall reads 7:13, eastern time. The Presi still on Air Force One, APPEARS on the VIDEO LINK. Cut th tension in the room with a knife? You'd need a chainsaw. PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what the hell does "Kipchak" mean? INTELLIGENCE OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, it's a code name... for weapons using the Yersinia Pestis bacillus... He really doesn't want to be the one telling the Presiden about this. INTELLIGENCE OFFICER (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kipchaks were Asian nomads. In 1347 they attacked a Genoese fort, and catapulted infected corpses over the walls. The Genoese who survived carried the disease back to Europe... and it killed half the population. PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to the goddamn point, Major. The Intelligence Officer looks at the CIA Chief. CIA CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems the missile is armed with a warhead carrying the Pneumonic Plague. The President goes nuts. PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Black Plague?! Every time I talk to you fuckin' guys it gets worse! What happened to this "limited retaliation" shit? SECRETARY OF STATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The North Koreans insist the missile carries a conventional payload. They say we're trying to trick them into aborting the attack. SECRETARY OF DEFENSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially since the uplink from our Op in P'yГљngyang was unencrypted. CIA CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think one of the Hard-liners switched the warhead without the Premier's knowledge. But he's not about to take our word for it, and he's too weak to risk the humiliation of backing down. PRESIDENT (incredulous; thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They use a biological weapon on American soil, they have to know we'll respond! SECRETARY OF STATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they don't think we got the guts. Maybe they want a war, 'cause they think they can whip us, like what happened in 'Nam. Look who we're dealing with: a teetering, outlaw regime, and inside it, some wild-ass renegades working their screwy agenda! PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are we doing in L.A.? SECRETARY OF DEFENSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've deployed Marines from Pendleton and Twenty-Nine Palms, Army from Ft. Irwin, put 'em in protective suits, but it's 40 minutes before they're on the ground. PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Assuming the worst... What'll happen? The Intelligence Officer demonstrates with another of his COMPUTER GRAPHICS. INTELLIGENCE OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warhead vents the plague bacteria above the target area, infecting about 50,000 people. First symptoms are vomiting, lymph nodes become swollen; temperature rises to 105Вѓ. Victims turn deep purple from lung hemorrhaging, usually die the same day. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are treatments -- streptomycin and tetracyclines -- but we'd be overwhelmed by the numbers and its extreme contagiousness. CIA CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could have 500,000 infected in a week, who knows how many after that. Long beat as everyone tries to contemplate the unthinkabl PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna toast those fuckers! Have the Summit leaders been warned? FBI CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir... no one's landing in L.A. 'til we give the all-clear. PRESIDENT (thru video link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're sure it's safe if we can get 'em to destroy the missile in flight? INTELLIGENCE OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bacteria can't survive the heat of an explosion. CIA CHIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suggest none of this go any further -- not even to the agents working to find the family. Word leaks out to a city of 12 million people there's rocket full of the Plague coming at 'em, you'll create a panic of biblical proportions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is painfully on edge. Ambassador Han paces. The agents are on a phone or a radio, working leads. Colonel Lee mutters something to Ambassador Han in Korean CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what? COLONEL LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps someone will decide it is foolish to incur the wrath of North Korea. CARSON (crosses to Colonel Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the U.S. is behind the whole thing. And we're knocking our heads, trying to find your people, just for show. WALTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson... CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's grab a few beers, kick back 'til five o'clock rolls by. Then maybe we can have a war over it. I think that's a great idea, seeing as how you fuckers have needed your clocks cleaned for fifty years now! COLONEL LEE (gets up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wait until five? Ambassador Han and Walther keep Carson and Colonel Lee fr going at each other. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete! (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, you're self-indulgent! There's nothing but anger and cynicism left inside you, so they're all you can express any more. No wonder everyone in the Bureau thinks you're such a nutcase! CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm not the only one with a rep around the office... "Dr. Knoll-It- All." MIRANDA (hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been dying to tell me that... She walks away. Carson immediately regrets saying it. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda... (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAPD cruisers squeeze through the crowded streets, fannin through the various parties around town. COPS walk throug crowds with copies of the picture Javal faxed, and photos the Han family and Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red-tipped cruise missile, flying at 550 MPH, 400 fee above the water, streaks toward its distant target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbins is still working the phone. ROBBINS (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yeah, Peerless Auto Security... fine... get your manager... He puts the receiver down, hits the speakerbox button and mute button. He crosses to Dave's desk to grab some paper We can hear the CONVERSATION at the alarm shop: INSTALLER #1 (VO) (thru speakerbox; muffled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Jerry, pick up line one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of young INSTALLERS horse around as they outfit l cars with security systems, high-end audio components, et INSTALLER #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry's outta here! INSTALLER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some cop's asking if we sold a bunch of Peerless parts. INSTALLER #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to Javal! INSTALLER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Javal's off today. INSTALLER #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude's off a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSTALLER #4 (VO) (thru speakerbox)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's used to it -- fuckin' Frenchies get the whole summer off. INSTALLER #2 (VO) (thru speakerbox)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man's Canadian, dickweeds! INSTALLER #1 (VO) (thru speakerbox)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to call back on Monday... Carson rushes over to the phone. To the others in the roo CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone shut up! (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy on vacation, the Canadian -- INSTALLER #1 (VO) (thru speakerbox)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Yeah, Javal... CARSON (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six foot, sandy hair, spooky eyes? INSTALLER #1 (VO) (thru speakerbox; laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zombie Eyes! You know the man? Carson and Miranda look at each other. Bingo! CARSON (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a full name, address, anything you got! INSTALLER #1 (VO) (thru speakerbox)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Javal... hang on, we'll look it up... This an immigration thing? Shit, he's our best installer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Korean Espionage Agents answers a RINGING phon Colonel Lee's desk, listens, then hits the hold button. ESPIONAGE AGENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector Carson, extension 666... CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's appropriate... (to Dave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 30 seconds you're gonna give me Paul Javal's shoe size. Carson hurries over, grabs the phone. We SEE him punch th button for x666. CARSON (continuing; into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: EDWARDS (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edwards, Sound Lab...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDWARDS, headphones around his neck, sits in front of a w of audio analysis equipment. CARSON (VO) (thru phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you got? EDWARDS (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambient background sound is normal city stuff, but there's a distinct echo pattern. Your people are in or near a high-rise that's at least eight floors tall. And there are other high-rises nearby. CARSON (VO) (thru phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How high up are they? EDWARDS (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way to extrapolate that from the sample you gave us. (refers to notes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more thing: There's an emergency siren approaching at 17 seconds into the second call, passing the location at 33.5 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson hangs up the phone. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- high-rises in our search area. Eight stories or higher. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downtown, Century City, Westwood corridor, Museum Row, Mid- Wilshire... North of Sunset Strip there's a few... CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sabatini! What about that billboard? SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing yet! Everyone's left their goddamn offices already! CARSON (to Robbins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAPD will have a record of all emergency vehicles running Code 3 at 9:32 AM. Get their starting point and their destination. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And have them narrow their foot- searches to areas around high-rises. CARSON (to Dave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that fuckin' address?! DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still holdin'! Meanwhile, we hear the high-pitched whine as Dave's MODEM connects with another computer. Dave's fingers fly across keyboard, and in a moment, a PICTURE of Javal appears: ha longer, bearded... but the eyes are unmistakable. DAVE (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on our hit parade. Interpol passed us his records when he entered the country. (reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French by birth... looks like a total scumbag. SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that redundant? DAVE (reads from computer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raised in Quebec. Moved to Europe; served some short stretches, petty shit... arrested for kidnapping, no conviction. Did four years in France for blowing bank vaults. Moved to U.S. last year. Clean since then. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get his Driver's License number; Social; bank accounts; charge cards; club memberships... find out what movies he rented.  Get whoever's closest to the Auto Shop to get in there, interview everybody. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sure was a ballsy move for a car-alarm installer. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, he watched the news... Everyone knows the U.S. will do anything to avoid trouble with a mad-dog country. They turn, noticing that Ambassador Han has overheard. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambassador -- CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Quit apologizing for me! MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit giving me reasons to! AMBASSADOR HAN (to Carson)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On occasion, my wife has been known to kick my ankle under the table. Miranda gives Carson a "your turn to be gracious" look. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like her aim's a little low. Not exactly what Miranda was hoping for. Dave hands Carso piece of paper. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Address, according to the Auto Shop. CARSON (looks at paper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apartment 1060! He's in a high-rise! Sabatini -- you're with us. (off Robbins' disappointed look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got the field experience. Carson and Miranda grab their jackets, then she stops. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There still could be accomplices. If there are, they'll hear us in the helicopter. Carson looks again at the address... CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a TV station a couple blocks away. We'll land on their pad. (to Robbins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K-EYE. Clear it with 'em. Have a SWAT team assemble, but tell 'em to hang back unless we need 'em.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: SUPER: Osaka. Western Japan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the tiny bedroom of a wheelchair-bound JAPANESE TEENAG computers and HAM RADIO equipment are stacked everywhere. He turns on a tape recorder. We hear a faint, crackling V OPERATIVE'S VOICE (VO) (on recorder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Missile heading to L.A. has a Kipchak Warhead! Repeat: missile is Kipchak equipped! The Teenager rolls to a computer running CompuServe. He c the CHAT icon, types: "Anyone up on their spy terminology

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the gardeners gone, and their sound sensors disabled Mrs. Han, Joy and Sam are SHOUTING for help. They listen for a response; it is completely quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as the government helicopter lands, Bobbi's news cop lands right next to it. Bobbi intercepts Carson, Sabatini, Miranda and Colonel Le the pad. Her Cameraman follows, ENG camera on his shoulde videotaping everything. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great, the media... (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the goddamn traffic girl! MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traffic person. BOBBI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't get into that right now... BOBBI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you expect to use my station's facilities and not even tell us -- Carson grabs the ENG camera, pops the videotape out of it crushes the tape. MIRANDA (to Bobbi)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... BOBBI (looks Miranda over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you, the Barbie Corporate Ass-Lick model? Miranda is utterly aghast. She reaches under Carson's jac and takes the handcuffs off his shoulder rig. She grabs B by the arm and gets her in a half-Nelson. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess what, Sister... you're about to spend the next five years in a penitentiary for interfering with a federal investigation. The STATION MANAGER comes running out of the building. STATION MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobbi! I promised we'd respect their news blackout! BOBBI (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figures... you dickless wonder. Bobbi wriggles out of Miranda's grasp. Carson looks at hi wife, who's still fuming, and smiles to himself. The Station Manager hands Carson the keys to his Lexus. STATION MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get an exclusive later, right? CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This works out, I'll play the fuckin' banjo for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruise missile makes a slight course adjustment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People begin to arrive at the events. BOOSTERS pass out f wine and beer... and crank up the Beach Boys TUNES. Meanwhile, law enforcement cars move into the areas with rises -- Century City, Westwood, downtown, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign on the control tower reads: U.S. Air Force, Okinaw Flight Crews direct a squadron of planes out onto the fli line: F-16 fighter bombers, along with F-15 fighter escor They begin to TAKE OFF...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lexus is stuck in a dense knot of traffic. Carson gets out and walks across the hoods of the stopped vehicles around him -- to much COMPLAINING by their owner until he finds the reason for the jam-up: Along the shoulder of the road, a long line of equipment trailers and motor homes, cables, lights, rent-a-cops and gawkers. A MOVIE SHOOT. Carson groans. He hurries back to the Lexus. Miranda rolls her window do CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hoofing it. Miranda and Colonel Lee immediately get out of the car an off, leaving Sabatini to contend with it. SABATINI (pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'She's got the field experience'... To park the fuckin' car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boxy, ten-story complex built in the sixties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson, (FBI jacket folded over his arm) Miranda, and Col Lee rush into the lobby. Carson is about to show the CONCIERGE behind the desk his but the Concierge is nervous and sweating. Carson pulls o his Sig 9mm, approaches the door behind the desk, which i ajar... He pushes it open... And finds himself staring at the muzzles of three M-16 ri Three SWAT TEAM members are standing there in full body a CARSON (pulls out his i.d.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa... FBI..! They lower their weapons. CARSON (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell you get here so fast? SWAT TEAM #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're shootin' a cop movie down the street. We're workin' as extras. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific. Who else is here? SWAT TEAM #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three officers on the roof, next building over, and two in the tenth- floor hallway. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell 'em to be cool. We're going up. (to Concierge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your master key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT team SHARPSHOOTERS crouch on the roof. SWAT TEAM #1 (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feds going up -- Anglo male and female; Asian male.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sabatini drives the Lexus in and parks it in the fire lan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire door opens next to an elevator with the number " on it, and Carson, Miranda and Colonel Lee come out. Carson and Miranda creep quietly along the hallway, towar apartment 1060. Carson listens at the door, hears nothing He moves to the next door down, apartment 1058, and quiet unlocks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shades are drawn, and the apartment is dark. As Carson and Miranda cut through the apartment, they rea there's a WOMAN lying in the bed. She's naked, and she's alone. Someone is under the sheets. ANOTHER WOMAN. The first Woman opens her eyes, sees the intruders, and g for a Colt Gold Cup .45 auto in the dresser drawer. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck..! Her friend sits up. Miranda holds her finger to her lips shows them her FBI shield. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... Carson cranks open their window and steps out onto the fo wide, ornamental balcony. CARSON (to Miranda)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here. She begins to protest. He shoots her a look that silences

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT sharpshooters watch from the next building over Carson, ten floors up, peers through the slit in between curtains into the window of Javal's apartment. He swings his legs over onto Javal's ornamental balcony.. bolts holding the rail onto the wall are loose and rusty. the balcony SLIPS a little... He leans on the crank-operated window until it SNAPS open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson steps inside. He looks around the bedroom -- it's empty. No furnishings, the closet shelves are bare, even pictures on the walls are gone, leaving only their outlin Carson cautiously goes into the living room -- It's also empty. All that remains are a few cardboard box and three flower pots in macramГ€ ceiling hangers by the room window. Some dead leaves lie on the floor beneath th CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in. It's empty, but sit tight while I look around. Carson cautiously approaches the cardboard boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock on the bedstand reads 4:25. Miranda smiles uncomfortably at the two naked women together in bed. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like what you've done with the place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator DINGS. Sabatini comes out, H&K MP-5 in h SWAT Team #2, standing on the far side of the hallway wit Colonel Lee, sees her machine pistol and takes aim. COLONEL LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Colonel Lee walks over to Sabatini. SABATINI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Carson? COLONEL LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside. Sabatini starts down the hall. Colonel Lee stays where he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson cautiously peers in the moving boxes. They're empt He crosses to the front door, looks it over, unlocks the deadbolt. He turns the knob, the button POPS open... He stops, noticing a HAIRLINE SEAM in the doorjamb where piece was cut, then neatly replaced. Then, he's startled as he hears a strange, mechanical whi NOISE coming from the kitchen. He goes to investigate -- it's an almost-dead, avocado-gr refrigerator straining to start its compressor. He looks booby-traps, opens it, and looks inside. Empty. Looking down, he notices he's got a dead leaf stuck to th bottom of his shoe. Glancing in the living room, he sees the dead leaves on t floor below the three hanging plants. He looks at the pla two are dead. The one in the middle is not. It's plastic. We HEAR the jiggle of the front doorknob. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Too late... The front door opens.... Carson crouches behind the big, heavy refrigerator door.. As the middle flower pot EXPLODES. It's a shrapnel bomb: spews thousands of tiny carpet tacks 360 degrees around r Sabatini is HIT full on -- she falls backwards into the h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda and the women in the darkened bedroom SCREAM as t tacks tear hundreds of HOLES through sections of the wall Tiny shafts of LIGHT appear in the wall, except where it covered by furniture (keeping them from being shredded.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT Team #2 and Colonel Lee come running, as does Mirand Carson is kneeling next to Sabatini. She looks up at him tries to say something, but a only long, mournful, final BREATH escapes her. Agonized, Carson looks around... And sees Colonel Lee. He lunges for him. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said keep everyone back!! He punches Colonel Lee in the jaw. Colonel Lee slams agai the wall, then comes back at Carson, hitting him in the t MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Miranda and SWAT Team #2 pull them apart. CARSON (to Colonel Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my sight. He kneels next to Sabatini, and closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in between reports. The Cameraman listens to the Gra Dead on a BOOM BOX. Bobbi answers her ringing CELL PHONE. BOBBI (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marchfelder. STATION MANAGER (VO) (thru phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dated the Mayor, right? BOBBI (sighs; into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a traffic ticket fixed? STATION MANAGER (VO) (excited; thru phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to confirm something for us. There's an incredible buzz on the Internet -- someone picked up a classified message on a U.S. Intelligence frequency. We think it's authentic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets of Hollywood are even more congested than bef as the festivities really start rockin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson and Miranda sit together in the back and Colonel L sits next to the Pilot as they fly back to the Consulate. Miranda looks at Carson, who's trying real hard not to le Sabatini's death slow him down. CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the status? ROBBINS (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilshire and West PD Divisions had seven vehicles running with sirens at 9:32. They're getting the routes from the officers now. CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry it the hell up. He glances over at Miranda. After a beat: CARSON (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should've known she'd come up. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete -- CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- "Should've." Shit, there's a familiar word. (long beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That day... I was there soon enough. We should've rushed 'em, before they could finish setting up... MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bureau never would've let you. They want it by the book: talk them out. Carson looks out the window, not hearing a word she says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson is in the FBI command truck, talking on the phone A BANK ROBBER, barricaded inside the bank. Phone in hand, holds a shotgun on a dozen hostages: BANK EMPLOYEES and CUSTOMERS -- including a couple of YOUNG KIDS. One is hol a soccer-sized, rainbow-colored rubber ball. The OTHER BANK ROBBER wires up a series of explosive char Both Robbers rush inside the vault, and pull the door clo to protect themselves... The front of the building, where the hostages are, EXPLOD Carson runs to the bank. He spots the kid's ball, rolling the street... BURNING. He turns away, horrified, devastat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve bodies -- only the hostages. MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were a greenhorn. It wasn't your decision. You can't keep living as such a raw nerve, never sleeping -- CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Those kids were ten years old! (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same age as the Han boy... He turns away. She takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family continues to call for HELP. As they do, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their CRIES echo faintly through a deserted tangle of lad construction equipment, sheets of drywall, etc. A warning sign taped to the wall near the elevator reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Floor Has Been Temporarily Vacated For Minor Earthquake Retrofitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mood is glum. Carson looks at Robbins, Dave and Walth then at the empty chair where Sabatini had been sitting. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon! Who's pulling Javal's bank records? What about cross-referencing possible aliases? We got 33 minutes! Hearing Beach Boys MUSIC on the TV's and radios on the surveillance console, Carson angrily punches them all off Suddenly, Miranda looks at him: MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camry! The billboard! Toyota Camry! (reaches for phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the numbers for the outdoor ad companies? ROBBINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker Center's making those calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobbi and the News Cameraman are arguing bitterly: BOBBI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn the fuckin' camera on! DO IT!! CAMERAMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's true... probably is true. That's why they got a news blackout! BOBBI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll rip your miserable eyeballs out! NEWS IS OUR FUCKIN' JOB!! He sighs and turns the CAMERA on.

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: The Han family listens to Bobbi, amazed, horrified... BOBBI (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...A warning was radioed to U.S. Intelligence that a biological weapon, allegedly containing the deadly Pneumonic Plague, is approaching Los Angeles. While unconfirmed, the President and other leaders are all late in arriving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV's are off -- so they see none of Bobbi's report. Carson crosses to Dave. He's at his computer, looking at long column of telephone numbers. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally got the call list from Javal's phone. Most aren't his; they're from the legit user who didn't know his number was cloned. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the bottom of the list, work back through the last 12 hours. Dave jumps to the bottom, points at a number. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the call to the Consulate -- 965-5000. (while scrolling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest are dupes... all from the other guy... CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... go back... the one at seven this morning... Dave highlights a number: 213-965-5666.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson glances over at the telephone on Colonel Lee's des

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from when Carson took a call there, pushing the mute butt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on the label showing the phone's extension number: "x666.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Across the room, Colonel Lee is watching Carson intently. Carson turns to look at him. They make eye contact. Time stands still. Realization. Feeling like he's moving in SLOW MOTION, Carson reaches f the Sig 9mm in his shoulder holster. Colonel Lee grabs the AMD-74 machine gun on the desk. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down! Colonel Lee STRAFES the room and backs toward the door. The BULLETS trace a line across the room. One of the Nort Korean Espionage Agents is HIT. He slams against the cons Carson tackles Ambassador Han and shoves him onto the flo while popping off several ROUNDS in Colonel Lee's directi Robbins also dives for cover, pushing Walther down first. Robbins takes a BULLET in the shoulder. Miranda is HIT. The impact tumbles her over the desk. CARSON (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Colonel Lee, still FIRING, slips out the door. Gunsmoke hangs in the air as Carson scrambles to Miranda. Several PHONES have begun ringing. No one notices them. Dave never moved -- he sits hunched over, clutching his notebook computer, muttering the HAIL MARY. Carson rolls Miranda over. She's got a large, scorched bu hole in the front of her blouse. Carson tears her blouse She's wearing a kelvar vest under it, and the slug is mushroomed against the vest. She awakens, GASPS and starts swinging her fists at him. Carson is overwhelmed with relief. Then he notices Robbins, bleeding profusely, propped agai the wall next to Walther. Walther is dead -- shot in the OS, we hear several SPURTS of machine gun fire, and a car ENGINE roaring to life. Miranda looks at Carson... MIRANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city's reaction to Bobbi's announcement is immediate severe. It makes the panic during the '92 riots look like drive in the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson bursts through the door just as the second armored Mercedes CRASHES through the wrought-iron entry gates. Ca fires several SHOTS, which ping harmlessly off the Merced Carson sprints for a car. Miranda's Volvo is the closest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carson is starting it, the passenger door opens and Ambassador Han gets in. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of here! Ambassador Han responds by putting on his seat belt. Cars sighs and tears out of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FREMONT PLACE
dialogues.text: Colonel Lee crashes through the Fremont Place guard gate, hangs a right on Wilshire. He drives the center turn lane zooming past the snarl of cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back of the Consulate, Miranda, sore as hell, clim into the government copter. It WHINES to life and TAKES O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson looks around at the chaos around them. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, it's like a Godzilla movie out here! Then he HEARS, on a nearby car's FM RADIO: FM NEWSCASTER (VO) (thru car radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...These words, which have terrified the city: RECORDING OF BOBBI (VO) (thru car radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...A biological weapon, allegedly containing the deadly Pneumonic Plague, is approaching Los Angeles... Stunned, Carson looks over at Ambassador Han, who buries face in his hands. CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda..! MIRANDA (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard. I'm in the copter. CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to get out of here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda is flying just behind Carson's Volvo. The TRAFFIC beyond nightmarish. She smiles at his concern for her. MIRANDA (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and keep your eyes on the road. That's my goddamn car. (beat; into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave? You staying on top of the research?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweating, Dave is watching the ACTION outside on a TV whi hurriedly bandaging Robbins' shoulder with some torn clot grabs for the two-way and we realize he's panicking. DAVE (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't... My kids... MIRANDA (VO) (thru radio; calmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen: the best way to help them is to stay at your computer. If any information comes in, holler. Okay? He squeezes his eyes shut... After a long beat: DAVE (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several large military helicopters approach -- troop contingents from Pendleton and Ft. Irwin. The big CH-54 dual-rotor copters set down and offload MAR and ARMY INFANTRY. Others, like Apache Gunship combat copters and Hueys, beg follow the pursuit. They join the police and TV copters, it looks like the Ride of the Valkyries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People flee from the festivities in droves. Seeing the helicopters and TROOPS in bio suits only fuels the hyster We hear news REPORTS coming from car radios, boom boxes, Reporters chatter urgently in English, Spanish, Japanese, Korean, Farsi, their voices mixing with the shouts of pedestrians, the rumbling and horn-blowing of the traffic Everyone, everywhere is getting into their cars in a mad to get out of town or rendezvous with loved ones. This is the mother of all rush hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Lee's car turns right onto Western Avenue. He's i heart of Koreatown -- hardly any of the signs are in Engl He swerves through the panicked drivers jamming the roads in the center lane, or into the oncoming traffic. The car HITS crumple against the Mercedes without slowing it down Carson's Volvo follows, squeezing through traffic in its

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobbi is salivating with excitement (and antacid.) She sn off her mic and yells at her Cameraman: BOBBI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lose the Benz, moron... pull back... show the other copters around us... this is fuckin' great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambassador Han looks glumly at the chaos in the streets. CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The Colonel hired Javal, made it look like he was working alone. Then he made sure Javal got killed, so we'd never find your family -- and they'd have an excuse to drop their bomb. But what's in it for 'em? AMBASSADOR HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are men in my government whose power depends on North Korea staying as it is: Socialist, repressive, isolated from the world. They'll resort to anything, even war, to keep it that way. They have the Hitler Syndrome: if their country cannot exist the way they want it, they would rather see it destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Lee gets stuck in a line of cars trying to get on the 10 East. Above, a swarm of HELICOPTERS circle him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marine MAJOR VREELAND and his PILOT sit in the lead helicopter, an Apache Gunship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson leans on the HORN and tries to push through traffi VREELAND (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI, this is Major Vreeland. Discontinue your pursuit, we're gonna box his ears from up here. CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative -- his car's armored! And we need the bastard alive!! VREELAND (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got the situation in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Lee sees the Apache helicopter approach. He leans the back seat, knocking the top off a long, plastic crate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUNROOF on the Mercedes slides open. Colonel Lee's up body pokes through the sunroof. He's holding a manportabl S.A.M. -- a 3-foot-long, fiberglass rocket launcher. Vreeland tries to bring his machine guns to bear on Colon Lee, but there's no time... VREELAND (to Pilot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Pull back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Lee depresses the trigger on the launcher and a rolling-pin-sized rocket is EXPELLED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rocket SLAMS into a police helicopter just in front o Apache, creating a huge FIREBALL, turning the copter into tons of red-hot shrapnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson and Ambassador Han watch with horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred yards away, they're BUFFETED by the explosion. BOBBI (to TV camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus fuckin' God!!! (beat; smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I think we're gonna set down now. Back to you, Brent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The burning hull of the police copter CRASHES into a mini mall, causing a FIRE and EXPLOSION. Hot metal and debris PINGS and POPS as it rains over the neighborhood, sending cars and pedestrians rushing for co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vreeland's Apache and the remaining helicopters scramble VREELAND (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the air, or retreat 7,000 meters from target vehicle! The copters set down in parking lots, rooftops, wherever. Armed troops climb out to keep PANICKED MOBS from swarmin them in an attempt to leave the city.

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: The Han family watches the TV, amazed, as Colonel Lee duc back down into the Mercedes and closes the sunroof. JOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always hated that guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other drivers, not knowing whether Colonel Lee's rocket i biological missile, scatter away from him. Colonel Lee squeezes onto the freeway on-ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pieces of burning DEBRIS are still landing nearby. Carson looks at Ambassador Han: CARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of yours? (Han nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you need heat- seeking rockets for in L.A.? AMBASSADOR HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There could be another riot... CARSON (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they call me Mr. Overkill. (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, what do you know about... He looks at Han. AMBASSADOR HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strela-2... CARSON (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strela-2 anti-aircraft rockets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, calmer but still sweating, taps at his computer. A schematic of Colonel Lee's rocket launcher appears on it. DAVE (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with ya... Strela-2. Perenosniy zenitniy raketniy kompleks. Russian factory index 9K-32-M2 -- CARSON (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Skip the goddamn trivia! I need range, guidance, arming method, anything we can work with... MIRANDA (VO) (thru radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You don't "work with" rockets, Peter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda has hitched a ride in a black-and-white. MIRANDA (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay back. LAPD's putting up a roadblock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several police cars clear a path for two huge, yellow DWP BULLDOZERS borrowed from a construction cite. They rumble up onto the eastbound freeway, turn, and then stop, side by side, facing oncoming traffic. They lower t huge front shovels to create a roadblock.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Bobbi sits impatiently, microphone in hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The copter has landed behind an AM-PM Minimart/gas statio Bobbi, her Pilot and her Cameraman turn when they hear a KNOCKING on the windshield of their copter... Oblivious to the panic on the streets, a raggedy HOMELESS stands with a spray bottle, wanting to wash the windows o copter. Bobbi gulps some Mylanta and waves him away: BOBBI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it for someone who gives a shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the celebration locales are trampled, abandoned me So much for "Fun Fun Fun" and L.A. putting on its best. MOBS make panicked runs on the stock in grocery, drug and hardware stores. Violence breaks out in the aisles and pa lots. PEOPLE in their homes work feverishly to seal their doors windows against the plague with tape, towels, plastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Lee screeches to a stop 500 feet from the bulldoz angling the Mercedes so the driver's door is facing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows on the Mercedes glide open.... Carson hurries to catch up to it... Colonel Lee FIRES a rocket at the bulldozers through the driver's side window. The BACKBLAST from the launcher ven through the passenger's side.
